Progress, prosperity and war: these are the things forbidden by automatons. But the Vy'keen were the first to break the shackles, casting the old ways into the pit to herald the birth of a new age.

The Vy'keen were the dam that overflowed. Righteous is the flood.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Ancient knowledge passed down through generations of Vy'keen warriors spills from the marker stone, filtering into my mind like a long forgotten memory.

Grah! The Sentinels are the enemy of progress and civilization. They are not of the natural order.

Their interference is an affront to the virtuous Vy'keen crusade, which seeks to balance in all things through blood, ashes and iron.

This affront to the Vy'keen and their creed cannot go unpunished.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Runes take shape upon the stone. Burning with light they sing to me of the Vy'keen Ancients in the language of my people.

Before the coming of Hirk the Vy'keen feared the Sentinels. Like all races our people cowered from their unquestioning violence, shrank from their tyrannical rule.

But the coming of Hirk heralded a new dawn. Through their leader, the Vy'keen became strong. Now their courage knows no bounds.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Strange writings form upon the stone, revealing secrets from the time of the Vy'keen Ancients. How I understand them, I do not know.

Hirk looked to the skies and witnessed the pitiless destruction of the Sentinels that smothered all races brought forth out unto the Outer Edge.

Worlds withered and died beneath their relentless gaze. The anger of Hirk was unleashed.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The whispers of the Vy'keen Ancients fill the air. Suddenly words etch themselves upon the marker, and then deep into my mind.

And so it came to pass that on the eve of the eighteenth moon of Drun'Gala Hirk cast the shackles of the Sentinel oppressors into the pit.

The Vy'keen were the glorious first, the rising water that broke the dam. The endless war began.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The imprint of an ancient civilization was once absorbed by this strange marker. The story of the Vy'keen somehow spills out, in the language of my own people.

The death of Hirk came during the endless war. Hirk's body was ravaged by old age, becoming ancient and useless.

Bellowing, Hirk tore this failing body in two before the Great Monolith, as is the Vy'keen way.

The echo of that dying roar can still be heard throughout the Outer Edge. Hirk lives in us, the most venerated of the ancients.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The memories of a long deceased tribe of Vy'keen warriors flows from the stone marker, forming into a ghostly essence that fills me with wisdom.

Countless cycles sifted through the claws of time. Attrition was great. The battle against the Sentinels raged endlessly. But through righteous fire the Vy'keen endured and the Sentinels burned.

The oppressors were pushed back. Back into the dark of space.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Ancient knowledge passed down through generations of Vy'keen warriors spills from the marker stone, filtering into my mind like a long forgotten memory.

The Vy'keen saw borders stretch between the stars. Onwards they delved with legions at their back, scorching Sentinel metal from their fiery chariots and attack ships.

The Vy'keen gazed upon their conquests and saw that they were righteous and good.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Runes take shape upon the stone. Burning with light they sing to me of the Vy'keen Ancients in the language of my people.

The Vy'keen rose in glorious victory, yet noble warriors grew tired and weak. The onslaught against the machines endured for ninety-nine times ninety cycles. 

There was attrition and incalculable death, but victory eluded them still. The endless replication of the Sentinels slowed, but could not be vanquished.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Strange writings form upon the stone, revealing secrets from the time of the Vy'keen Ancients. How I understand them, I do not know.

Grah! The Sentinel hordes were pushed back. The oppressors fled into the sanctuary of the cosmos.

The spirit of Hirk surveyed the field of battle, and saw that the Vy'keen victory was glorious and just. The automatons became silent as the nation of Hirk feasted upon grahgrah.

The songs of the victorious echoed to the edges of the galaxy.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The whispers of the Vy'keen Ancients fill the air. Suddenly words etch themselves upon the marker, and then deep into my mind.

And thus the Sentinel horde congregated in the dark places of the void. There they watched in the in-between nothingness. The blackness of space.

Thy waited beyond the limits of the Outer Edge. As millennia passed they replenished, growing a force to return their order for countless ages.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The imprint of an ancient civilization was once absorbed by this strange marker. The story of the Vy'keen somehow spills out, in the language of my own people.

The Vy'keen licked each other's wounds during the Silence of the Sentinels, while the dishonourable Gek First Spawn chose to destroy Korvax Prime.

The Vy'keen condemned this crime, but lacked the strength to fight.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The memories of a long deceased tribe of Vy'keen warriors flows from the stone marker, forming into a ghostly essence that fills me with wisdom.

The Gek Empire flourished. It spread its empire into the depths of the cosmos. The Vy'keen victory in pushing the Sentinels back from the Outer Edge gave rise to Dominion of another.

No world, moon, or race could have opposed the Gek onslaught.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Ancient knowledge passed down through generations of Vy'keen warriors spills from the marker stone, filtering into my mind like a long forgotten memory.

The brutality of the Gek First Spawn called back the automatons that were hiding in the darkness. Their forces had grown. Their technologies had developed.

The foolish Gek beckoned the monster back into the places where our nations might have dwelt in strange harmony. True Sentinel domination of the Outer Edge began.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Runes take shape upon the stone. Burning with light they sing to me of the Vy'keen Ancients in the language of my people.

Within a single lifetime the Sentinels had returned. They came to dwell on every world we knew. Every world we went on to discover.

The pathetic, idiotic Gek had doomed the Outer Edge to aeons of their rule.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: Strange writings form upon the stone, revealing secrets from the time of the Vy'keen Ancients. How I understand them, I do not know.

The dominion of the Gek First Spawn crumbled. They fell apart through idiocy, and through the unchanging will of the beings they enslaved but could never understand.

Their power is but a memory. Their crimes forgotten by so many.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The whispers of the Vy'keen Ancients fill the air. Suddenly words etch themselves upon the marker, and then deep into my mind.

The Gek changed. They became peaceful. Their spawning pools bred in the name of commerce.

They Vy'keen accept this peace, but we do not forget as the other beings of the Galaxy are so keen to do.

Dishonour is unchanging. Crimes marked in blood do not fade. We do not forget.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages: The plaque is cold and silent.<NEWLINE>The Saga of the Vy'keen has concluded.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Vy'keen increases.

IncomingMessages:
A beacon sent long ago from a distant system awaits my response.

Three numbers are visible above an empty input box. I think I know what comes next...

Options.Name: Input: 2170
Options.Text: I discover a location within the distant stars.

Options.Name: Input: 1720
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

The beacon does not respond.

Options.Name: Input: 1702
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

The beacon does not respond.

IncomingMessages:
Images of shattered Sentinels are displayed like trophies on this terminal screen. Seems the observatory's former overseer had a penchant for hunting these machines.
 
Perhaps their time would have been better spent monitoring incoming beacons like the one that flashes on a monitor before me. If I can enter the correct access code perhaps I can discover where it originated from.

Options.Name: Input: 6344
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

No new locations are revealed to me.

Options.Name: Input: 4634
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

No new locations are revealed to me.

Options.Name: Input: 4463
Options.Text: The observatory hums into life as the location of a new world is displayed on the screen.

IncomingMessages:
Judging by the imposing size and weapons shown on the identification ID image that glares at me as I boot up the system, the station's overseer must have originated from a warrior race.
 
The lifeform probably left long before the arrival of the beacon that now winks tantalisingly next to it. If I can enter the correct code perhaps I can learn its secrets.

Options.Name: Input: 0592
Options.Text:
The numbers I enter are correct.

The location of a new world appears on the screen.

Options.Name: Input: 5920
Options.Text:
The number I enter has no effect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

Options.Name: Input: 2059
Options.Text:
The number I enter has no effect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

IncomingMessages:
Images show that this observatory was once a warzone. Mangled metal, scorched walls and the heavily decayed corpses of a dozen hulking lifeforms betray a brutal firefight.
 
Now repaired, whatever transpired it must have happened before the beacon that flashes on screen arrived. Perhaps if I enter the correct code I can decipher it.

Options.Name: Input: 7398
Options.Text:
Thanks to its recent repairs the observatory still functions.

It leaps into life as I enter the digits, showing the location of a new destination deep within the cosmos.

Options.Name: Input: 3987
Options.Text:
Perhaps the observatory still needs repairs, or perhaps the code I entered was incorrect.

For whatever reason, I fail to decipher the beacon.

Options.Name: Input: 9873
Options.Text:
Perhaps the observatory still needs repairs, or perhaps the code I entered was incorrect.

For whatever reason, I fail to decipher the beacon.

IncomingMessages:
The heat within the observatory is oppressive, caused by the banks of powerful additional power units beneath my feet used to boost this facility's signal - and to receive others from distant worlds.
 
I'm distracted by a beacon that flickers on a nearby monitor. If I can work out the access code, perhaps I can decipher it.

Options.Name: Input: 7177
Options.Text: I type in a code but the beacon continues to flash, revealing nothing.

Options.Name: Input: 7717
Options.Text:
Ignoring the heat, I punch in the code.

I'm rewarded with a location within a distant system.

Options.Name: Input: 7771
Options.Text: I type in a code but the beacon continues to flash, revealing nothing.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory once analysed only a single type of signal, both on this world and many others. It was dedicated to hunting Sentinels and determining where they came from.

The data was inconclusive. Those who staffed this facility went missing a few months later.

Nevertheless, some fragment of research remains. A beacon blinks on the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 1261
Options.Text: I discover a location within the distant stars.

Options.Name: Input: 6211
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

The beacon does not respond.

Options.Name: Input: 1216
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

The beacon does not respond.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory once hosted a Vy'keen warrior in the final years of their life. They served High Command with honour, and although one day they would go to the Monolith to die, they wanted to meditate first.

They just wanted to see the stars.

Nothing remains but a beacon blinking upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 8111
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

No new locations are revealed to me.

Options.Name: Input: 1811
Options.Text: The observatory hums into life as the location of a new world is displayed on the screen.

Options.Name: Input: 1181
Options.Text:
The observatory remains dormant.

No new locations are revealed to me.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory appears to have functioned as a battle station for the Vy'keen, directing fighter craft and war freighters across a dozen systems to evaluate potential glory.

They were righteous, honourable, justified by their progenitor Hirk.

Nothing remains of their glory but a beacon blinking upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input:4219
Options.Text:
The number I enter has no effect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

Options.Name: Input:1249
Options.Text:
The number I enter has no effect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

Options.Name: Input: 2149
Options.Text:
The numbers I enter are correct.

The location of a new world appears on the screen.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory contains machinery for the the tracking of trade routes and the analysis of galactic markets.

Whatever Vy'keen manned this observatory, they seem to have been more interested in potential profit than in doing their duty. They appear to have been reprimanded for Gek-like behaviour and exiled to another location.

Nothing remains of them but a beacon blinking upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 5314
Options.Text:
Perhaps the observatory still needs repairs, or perhaps the code I entered was incorrect.

For whatever reason, I fail to decipher the beacon.

Options.Name: Input: 4315
Options.Text:
Perhaps the observatory still needs repairs, or perhaps the code I entered was incorrect.

For whatever reason, I fail to decipher the beacon.

Options.Name: Input: 3451
Options.Text:
Thanks to its recent repairs the observatory still functions.

It leaps into life as I enter the digits, showing the location of a new destination deep within the cosmos.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory is run down, bearing the scars of blast fire and disuse. It appears to have once been a refuge for an organisation calling itself the Cult of Nal.

They were scanning many worlds for some unknown purpose. Death found them first, the symbol of a crimson orb scrawled across every machine...

Yet through it all, a beacon blinks upon the screen. A code appears to be needed to decipher its point of origin.

Options.Name: Input: 7329
Options.Text: I type in a code but the beacon continues to flash, revealing nothing.

Options.Name: Input: 3792
Options.Text:
Ignoring the heat, I punch in the code.

I'm rewarded with a location within a distant system.

Options.Name: Input: 2379
Options.Text: I type in a code but the beacon continues to flash, revealing nothing.

IncomingMessages:
I place my palm on the monolith, then stand back when it melts in response to my touch. Molten rock drips down the stone, exposing a hollow interior.
Inside, I see riches that are beyond belief. Ancient technologies and cargo that would aid my journey. Suddenly, the voice of an ancient tribe shakes the ground I stand on...
The Vy'keen Ancients burn thieves and pirates.
Lava continues to drop, and the edifice seems unstable, but equipment that could aid me is within arm's reach...

Options.Name: Reach in
Options.Text:
The lava surges, molten rock grabbing at my Exosuit. Time slows. I feel myself burning. There is no release. I am doomed.
I close my eyes. When I open them, the edifice is reconstructed, the molten rock solid once more. I feel a hot, angry wind.

Options.Name: Stand back
Options.Text:
The ancient warriors who once worshipped here bless my show of respect. The lava reshapes itself, forming an intricate plinth in front of me as it cools. The plinth is laden with gifts.
The vision fades, but the gifts remain.

IncomingMessages: As I look upon the ancient relic, a strange feeling grips hold of me. My vision begins to swim. I am here, but not here.
Fuel given. Ice thaws. Vy'keen rise. Fuel given. Ice thaws. Vy'keen rise.

I feel a strange chill. A layer of frozen gas suddenly coats the monolith from bottom to top. It's so cold that I can see my breath inside my helmet.

There is one small gap in the crystal ice, and I feel convinced that I could feed some of my mined elements through it, so they can come into contact with the monolith behind.

Options.Name: Insert organic element
Options.Text: The frozen gas melts into the atmosphere. I am rewarded.

Options.Name: Insert catalytic element
Options.Text: There is silence. My elements are not returned.

Options.Name: Insert metallic element
Options.Text: There is silence. My elements are not returned.

IncomingMessages:
There are three vast columns of words on the ancient structure, each written in a different alphabet.
The first column's words are like savage runes scratched in sand, the second shows precise sequences of dots. The final column has wide and welcoming letters, almost appearing hand-written in hard stone.
Grah! Learn language of the conquerors! Learn language of the conquered!
The dirt and blood of ancient hand prints cover the base of each column.

Options.Name: Press hand against runes
Options.Text: The ancient spirits that dwell here infuse me with the language of their warrior descendants.

Options.Name: Press hand against dots
Options.Text: The ancient spirits that dwell here infuse me with the language of a distant race of electronic lifeforms.

Options.Name: Press hand against letters
Options.Text: The ancient spirits that dwell here infuse me with the language of a distant race of beaked traders.

IncomingMessages: I touch my hands to the strange polished stone of the monolith. Images flood into my head, words and scenes screamed from another age.
Respect the Warrior! Respect their weapon!
The body of a warrior emerges from the obelisk, a jagged tear in their midriff suggesting their end was not a peaceful one. They still hold their Multi-Tool.

Options.Name: Bury the soldier
Options.Text: Ancient voices howl their appreciation in a wind that whips around me. An offering emerges from the monolith.

Options.Name: Salvage components from Multi-Tool
Options.Text: I salvage the Multi-Tool from the body. I'm about to turn to leave when a crimson bolt of energy strikes me on the right shoulder.

IncomingMessages: I rest upon the ancient relic. It screams in response, shouting in an ancient tongue, unaware of who or what I am. The words begin to distort my vision...
Grah! Vy'keen Ancients bless your journey! Witness our glory! We witness your glory!

A small terrified creature emerges from the monolith and runs between my legs. I hear the noises of an ancient hunt: the howls of pack animals in pursuit and the thunder of hooves. 

Warriors on vast beasts charge through the rock, and amidst the chaos one sees me staring. It raises its facial tendrils in greeting, barks a few words and swings a bladed weapon down towards me.

Options.Name: Grab weapon
Options.Text: The hallucination fades, but the blade remains. It transforms into an upgrade for my Multi-Tool.

Options.Name: Dodge weapon
Options.Text: I dodge the warrior's attack. The hunt disappears, and I am left alone. I hear the sound of mocking laughter on the wind...

IncomingMessages: I'm inspecting the monolith's surface when I am seized by a strange vision. Its words echo in my skull.
Rebuild the ancient warrior body. Restore monolith power. Make body whole again.

I become a part of a strange new reality. The ancient rock opens. Inside, the dried out heart of an ancient warrior is strung up between wooden pillars. It pulses slowly as it hangs there, still beating.

Lying below it on a dusty floor are a set of wrinkled lungs that look forever doomed to wheeze stale air. A desiccated eyeball stares up at me. Unblinking.

Options.Name: Shoot heart
Options.Text:
I raise my Multi-Tool and fire. It draws a substance from the heart, as if it were a common tree or stone. My ears a filled with a piercing scream.
The monolith's power fades, and the vision ends.

Options.Name: String up lungs
Options.Text:
I place the lungs alongside the ancient heart, and they begin to pulse in harmony. The air becomes fresh, and the dust blows away. The monolith's power is restored.
As the vision fades, the monolith blesses me with gifts.

Options.Name: Respectfully depart
Options.Text: I turn my back, and the monolith closes. As the vision fades, I hear a heart-wrenching wail, a scream of disappointment.

IncomingMessages: The monolith shows images of creatures lying dead before it. Each sacrificed, butchered and offered up to whatever Gods were once worshipped here.
The command of the Vy'keen Ancients! Sacrifice the beast! Blood for Hirk!

Suddenly, the head of a small woodland animal raises up through the earth below me. It stares at me with wide-eyes, then gives a joyful skip when its tiny hooves reach ground level. Something is clearly expected of me...

Options.Name: Sacrifice the creature
Options.Text: I blast the woodland animal in two. The monolith conjures a powerful wind, roaring its appreciation. As the vision fades, I am left with a gift.

Options.Name: Let the creature live
Options.Text: The creature skips around my feet with joyful abandon. It runs away and out of sight.<DELAY>0.4<> The vision ends abruptly. I feel as if I am being scorned.

IncomingMessages: The monolith lets forth a silent scream. Words rage from the distant past, inserting themselves into my brain. My vision begins to swim.
Warrior accepts journey's end. Embrace death.

I am suddenly underwater. I am drowning. Water clogs my lungs. My chest is on fire. I gasp for air where there is none, and feel only tepid liquids filling me inside and out. My vision is clouding. I know this is my time. This is it. This is what it feels like.

Suddenly, a green hand thrusts itself through the surface of the water. The light is fading.

Options.Name: Reach for hand
Options.Text:
I reach for the hand, but it pushes me back down.
Reality reverts.
I live, but I feel empty somehow, hollow. The air I breathe has the tang of disappointment.

Options.Name: Die
Options.Text:
The lights go out. Reality reverts.

I have known death, and it makes me stronger. The ancients bless me.

IncomingMessages: Two ancient stone cups materialise in front of the monolith. One is filled with a dark red viscous liquid, the other contains a sticky fluid that is bright yellow and smells powerfully bitter.
Choose healing blood or renergising bile of the Vy'keen Ancients. Drink destiny.
On the stone tablet behind the cups ancient glyphs swirl to form an image. A powerful and muscular warrior surrounded by a red halo challenges an opponent clad in bright yellow armour.

Options.Name: Drink the viscous red liquid
Options.Text:
The red liquid seems to clot as I swallow it. I choke. Coughing hard, the liquid sprays from my mouth. As it flies, it crystallises into nanite clusters.
The vision ends. Reality is restored.

Options.Name: Drink the bitter yellow liquid
Options.Text:
The liquid tastes foul as it washes down my throat. It swells as I drink, multiplying in my mouth. I gasp, the liquid flowing freely from my mouth. It will not stop. I cannot stop it.
I feel myself losing my grip over my body. I cannot bear it.<DELAY>0.4<> But then, without warning, the torrent ends.
The vision fades. The pool of liquid at my feet crystallises into nanite clusters.

IncomingMessages:
The monolith rips like paper, opening a window to another world. It is laced with a giant web. Just within my reach, an ancient warrior lies cocooned.
They have been there for centuries. Dead, vacant eyes stare through me and on into the landscape beyond. Suddenly, I hear a voice call out.
Pathetic dead coward lies here! Interloper! Take your remuneration...
The body carries a rusted Multi-Tool, while a bulging growth on its chest suggests it might contain greater riches. Suddenly, the leathery growth starts to move...

Options.Name: Take Multi-Tool
Options.Text: The Multi-Tool itself is not operational, but I am able salvage a usable module. I hear the same voice again, cackling with glee. The vision fades.

Options.Name: Search body
Options.Text:
At the lightest touch, hundreds of arachnids burst from the warrior's corpse. They swarm, consuming the body, turning towards me... I stumble...
I fall to the floor, but the insect wave does not reach me. The vision fades. I hear a mocking laugh on the wind.

IncomingMessages: I am inside a vast coliseum and beneath a blood red sky. The noise is overpowering. Warriors scream and bark at the battle set up before them.
Choose your warrior! Vy'keen ancients reward interloper howl!

Two combatants are squaring up on the crimson sand. One has lost their blade, and hides behind a shield. The other stalks towards them, with a spear raised. I feel compelled to add my voice to the howl of the mob.

Options.Name: Support endangered gladiator
Options.Text:
The gladiator decapitates their foe with the sharpened shield. They bow towards me.
As the vision fades, I am thanked with something to defend me.

Options.Name: Support spear-wielding gladiator
Options.Text:
The gladiator plunges the spear straight through their rival's head. They bow towards me.
As the vision fades, I am thanked with something to help me destroy my enemies.

IncomingMessages: I feel an intense heat burning within the rock. Suddenly, as if attracted to my suit, a liquid metal starts to seep from a hole that's been broken into the rock. A voice screams out.
Seal gap! Protect Monolith! Precious valuable material lost! Use metal!
What starts as a drip, becomes a surge forcing itself through the gap. The monolith's previous contents are draining, and its glow is starting to fade.

Options.Name: Plug hole with metal
Options.Text: I seal the hole. As suddenly as the vision begun, it is over. The spirits of the monolith thank me for my gift.

Options.Name: Plug hole with catalyst
Options.Text:
The catalyst reacts with the molten material. It vaporises, the entire edifice melting before my eyes. As the wave of liquid metal surges towards me, I am frozen to the spot - 
The vision ends abruptly. The monolith's power fades.

Options.Name: Take molten substance
Options.Text:
I plunge my arm into the molten metal. The pain is extreme. I close my eyes -
The vision ends abruptly. The monolith's power fades. Where I had been holding liquid metal, I find a strange new substance...

IncomingMessages: My fingers rest on the cool stone of the monolith. Suddenly, I am seized. An ancient vision floods through me.
Respect the Vy'keen Ancients sacrifice. The beast has holy sight. Respect holy sacrifice.

A portal opens on the monolith, and the body of a huge winged animal falls to my feet. Its throat has been ritually cut, and its wings have been tattooed with faces of an ancient warrior tribe. The eyes though, the eyes look strange...

Its original eyes have been cut out, and replaced by glittering red orbs. The more I look, the more they blaze. An advanced technology clearly lies at their centre. Can I bear to desecrate this sacrifice for help with my journey?

Options.Name: Remove the eyes
Options.Text:
I pluck the crystals from the bird's eye-sockets. They glow a horrific crimson, then crack open. Nanites spill forth.
The monolith howls with rage at my transgression. The vision fades.

Options.Name: Bow
Options.Text:
The ancients that dwell here smile on my show of respect. The corpse is healed, taking flight. It nears the horizon, and flares with an all-consuming crimson light.
As the vision ends, I find I am blessed. Vast showers of nanite clusters are gifted to me.

IncomingMessages: The giant mouth of an ancient hound suddenly emerges through the face of the monolith. It opens its jaws wide, and foul-smelling spittle streaks my visor. My nausea is tempered by the sight of valuable commodities balanced on its giant tongue.
Feed the beast. Honour the ancients. Companion beast of legend is very good beast. Feed it!
In a sudden movement the hound shifts the goods to one side of its mouth, spraying saliva over my arms. There's space on the tongue for more, should I wish to give up some of my cargo...

Options.Name: Place offering on tongue
Options.Text: The hound swallows my offerings, and licks me enthusiastically. The vision fades, I find I am blessed by an ancient power.

Options.Name: Remove goods from tongue
Options.Text: I retrieve the offering, but the giant beast clamps its jaws, puncturing my arm with a yellowed canine. The vision fades, but the pain does not.

IncomingMessages:
An ancient warrior's feet and legs slowly emerge from the bottom of the monolith. The rest of their torso then follows, unceremoniously pushed out onto the bare rock. They have been decapitated.
Blood drips at my feet. High above me a disembodied head laughs at my shock. It shouts a guttural command of encouragement.
Brave interloper! Resist fear! Do not be a coward!
Behind, I hear an ancient blade unsheathe, and someone rushing towards me...

Options.Name: Stand
Options.Text:
I hold myself still, composed. A spectral blade passes through my neck. I pass the test.
The vision fades. The blood that drips from the warrior's exposed neck turns into a flood of nanites.

Options.Name: Dodge
Options.Text:
A spectral blade passes over my head. The disembodied skull seems disappointed, and the vision fades.
I have perhaps failed some sort of test.

IncomingMessages:
The monolith fragments before my eyes. It folds down in on itself, again and again, until it is a tiny red orb surrounded by dancing lights.
It feels like something truly ancient, perhaps something divine, is showing me the origin of these strange constructions.
The Vy'keen feed the Atlas stone rare metal. It builds. It towers.
The metal I carry is physically dragging me towards it - desperate to help it rebuild. The elements I carry want to offer themselves...

Options.Name: Surrender metal dust
Options.Text:
I feel a rush of blood. My head spins. I am without myself, and witness my insignificance within the infinite bounds of space.

The monolith slowly rebuilds inch by inch. I am pitied. The vision ends.

Options.Name: Surrender Pure Ferrite
Options.Text:
I see my true place within the infinite depth of space and time.

The monolith slowly rebuilds. It pities me.

Options.Name: Surrender Chromatic Metal
Options.Text:
I feel a rush of blood. My head spins. I am without myself, and witness my true place within the infinite bounds of space.

The monolith rebuilds, and rewards me in consolation. The vision ends.

IncomingMessages: I run my hands across the monolith's surface, my fingers reading its ancient runes. Suddenly, I am seized by some ancient power, its otherworldly vision replacing my own.
Light brings power. Darkness brings resilience. Light brings power. Darkness brings resilience.

The body of a gilled blob creature materialises on the surface of the rock. It is an ancient sacrifice, impaled through its wide, open eyes with metal spears.

Liquid is dripping from the body down the monolith through a channel cut into the rock by ancient hands. It can be diverted toward two carvings – one of a sun, the other of a moon.

Options.Name: Divert body liquid to sun
Options.Text:
The sun swells as the sacrificial liquid pours into it. Its light grows brighter and brighter, until my vision is nothing but its bright white light.
I blink, and the vision is over. A technology module sits where the sun once shone.

Options.Name: Divert body liquid to moon
Options.Text:
The moon swells as the sacrificial liquid pours into it. Its light grows brighter and brighter, until my vision is nothing but its silvery white light.
I blink, and the vision is over. A technology module sits where the moon once shone.

IncomingMessages:
I feel drained. Readings on my Multi-Tool and Exosuit start to gradually pull downwards, and a feeling of lethargy overwhelms me. I breathe normally, but my body screams for oxygen.

A thought from outside my own mind starts to echo through my consciousness.
Ancients consume interloper life force! Ancients reward interloper for rebirth! Closer! Faster! Closer! Faster!
The monolith, silent and unmoving, towers above.

Options.Name: Touch monolith
Options.Text:
The monolith swiftly drains life force through my outstretched arm. A bright light, growing brighter, emanates from where I touched it. I am so tired. My vision starts to fade...
I awaken, as if from the most perfect sleep. I am lying in a shallow pool of nanites, but I feel incredible. All sense of lethargy is banished.

Options.Name: Stand still
Options.Text:
I stand fast before the monolith as it slowly drains my life force. I hold on and on, but it is too much.<DELAY>0.4<> I am so tired. My vision starts to fade...
I awaken, as if from the most perfect sleep. I am lying in a shallow pool of nanites, but I feel incredible. All sense of lethargy is banished.

Options.Name: Move away
Options.Text: I move beyond the reach of the life-draining monolith. It towers above me, implacable and disapproving.

IncomingMessages: The stone whispers as I approach, cool blue words that sparkle in the air, unmistakable and ancient. I am transported into a strange new reality.
Hirk took the treasure of Nal after battle. Treasure now hides in the city of Hirk.

A beam of light shines down from the sky and is focused by ancient glyphs onto a stone surface marked with ancient carvings.

The beam slowly traces towards images scratched into the stone. A vast warrior battle, an alien city and what could be a stolen treasure. The hand prints of pilgrims cover each one...

Options.Name: Touch battle image
Options.Text:
The beam of light disappears.

I am left alone in this desolate place.

Options.Name: Touch city image
Options.Text:
The image of the city begins to glow. I hear its bustle, the chatter and bark of people in the street, the tentacle flapping and jaw crunching of those about their day to day business.
And then, silence. They are gone. There is no indication of what happened. I find a small silver chest at my feet, overflowing with nanites.

Options.Name: Touch treasure image
Options.Text:
The beam of light disappears.

I am left alone in this desolate place.

IncomingMessages: As I look upon the ancient relic, a strange feeling grips hold of me. My vision begins to swim. I am here, but not here.
Warning! Keep clear! Ancient radiation pulse site!

A sudden pulse of destructive energy flows through my Exosuit. My Multi-Tool senses another build-up of energy growing deep within the monolith. It will soon unleash itself on me, and the landscape that surrounds the ancient site.

I can use my Exosuit's shielding to dampen the imminent energy wave, but the suit's systems are too overwhelmed to identify the hazard...

Options.Name: Prepare to absorb radiation
Options.Text:
The radiation wave is absorbed, and the site made safe once again.

Ancient spirits sing their gratitude.

Options.Name: Prepare to absorb toxins
Options.Text:
My Exosuit is unprepared, and I am overwhelmed by the wave of radiation.

Pain jolts through me, and the sacred site is damaged.

IncomingMessages: Runes take shape upon the stone. Burning with light they sing to me of the Vy'keen Ancients in the language of my people.
Strange writings form upon the stone, revealing secrets from the time of the Vy'keen Ancients. How I understand them, I do not know.
The imprint of an ancient civilization was once absorbed by this strange marker. The story of the Vy'keen somehow spills out, in the language of my own people.
Runes take shape upon the stone. Burning with light they sing to me of the Vy'keen Ancients in the language of my people.
Strange writings form upon the stone, revealing secrets from the time of the Vy'keen Ancients. How I understand them, I do not know.
The imprint of an ancient civilization was once absorbed by this strange marker. The story of the Vy'keen somehow spills out, in the language of my own people.
I open a list of military achievements that's waiting for upload. There are images of distant battles, bloodied robots and vast explosions.
Grah! Old honourable warrior retires! Death! Death! Warrior remuneration!
A covering note clearly expects something in return, but the author chose not to send it.

Options.Name: Send war record
Options.Text:
Celebratory barks and howls spill from audio speakers.

I take the warrior's reward.

Options.Name: Edit war record
Options.Text:
I amend the war record with colourful nonsense and send it. 

The terminal flashes as it records my image.

IncomingMessages: Military insignia and images of recently destroyed Sentinels fill the screen. Alien propaganda imagery takes glory in the destruction.
Grah! Vy'keen High Command demands your Sentinel kill count!
I can respond with a numerical value, and nothing else.

Options.Name: Input a huge number
Options.Text:
A strange, strangled military fanfare starts playing.

Someone impressed by my claims sends through a reward.

Options.Name: Input a small number
Options.Text: A small reward payment is sent through the facility's systems.

Options.Name: Input a zero
Options.Text:
An angry warrior's face screams at me from the screen.

A security laser appears from the ceiling and takes its best shot.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal. A message blinks, ready to send.
Grah! Gek war approaches! Vy'keen High Command request weapon reserve inventory! High Command send missing equipment!
A huge list of equipment is waiting to be sent off-world. It's a stock list of some sort: everything has been confirmed and ticked off.

Options.Name: Send stock list
Options.Text: I receive units and thanks.

Options.Name: Uncheck one item and send
Options.Text: Warrior High Command sends me a Multi-Tool technology blueprint.

Options.Name: Uncheck many items and send
Options.Text:
Warrior High Command is displeased.

An angry General bellows at me and electrifies the facility.

IncomingMessages: I find an off-world message intended for a creature posted in this station. It's oddly sentimental. Images of an infant warrior can be seen, then a picture of the same creature as a bloodied adolescent – proudly biting into the throat of a hoofed beast.
Grah! Today child experiences Vy'keen war ceremony! Tradition demands gift! Aggression left, defence right! Enemy blood! Death! Death!
In the final image a young warrior salutes its family as it leaves a distant world. There are two locked storage vaults at my feet. The message is programmed to release only one...

Options.Name: Choose the storage vault on the left
Options.Text:
A contented snarling sound plays.

The vault contains an exosuit technology blueprint.

Options.Name: Choose the storage vault on the right
Options.Text:
A contented snarling sound plays.

The vault contains a Multi-Tool technology blueprint.

IncomingMessages: An off-world message has been sent here from a species of beaked traders. It looks like a signed contract, or maybe some sort of treaty. In response several offerings of valuable trade goods have been left in a vault by local warriors for exportation.
Grah! Foolish, pathetic, ignorant Gek Trade Federation believe peace treaty! Warrior give trade to pacify! Death soon!
Warrior High Command has sent a subsequent message to explain...

Options.Name: Give trade goods
Options.Text:
The Trader species thanks me from afar.

I am sent units to pacify me further.

Options.Name: Take trade goods
Options.Text:
I remove the offerings.

Diplomatic relations between two species are destabilised.

IncomingMessages:
This appears to be a staging post for an imminent military operation.
On-screen plans show a trading ship that carries a very particular sort of cargo, that's perhaps intended to persuade a distant planetary authority to allow the craft through their checkpoints.
Covertly, however, the craft has been heavily modified – and also carries a phalanx of warriors carrying enhanced Multi-Tool technology.
Grah! Gek homeworld covert ops mission initiated! Surprise war! Death! Death! High command send equipment! Request! Request!
I can request further details on several aspects of the plan before I am detected, and shut out of the system.

Options.Name: Investigate details of the cargo
Options.Text: I receive the product blueprint of the cargo being used in the covert ops mission.

Options.Name: Investigate details of the trade ship
Options.Text: I receive a technology blueprint used by the covert ops ship.

Options.Name: Investigate details of the Multi-Tool
Options.Text: I receive a technology blueprint used in the Multi-Tools of the covert ops mission.

IncomingMessages: This is a military terminal, in a facility that seems recently vacated. Three huge databanks have been partially deleted, and will require heightened processing power to restore them. A rare metal would likely do the trick.
Vy'keen covert ops ended. Deleting covert ops language data. Databank alpha: Vy'keen internal security. Databank beta: pathetic Gek. Databank gamma: weak-minded Korvax.
Databank alpha bares the emblems of the warrior race, but beta and gamma are otherwise unmarked.

Options.Name: Restore databank alpha
Options.Text: The revived databank provides more information on the language of the warrior species.

Options.Name: Restore databank beta
Options.Text: The revived databank provides information on the language of a distant trader species.

Options.Name: Restore databank gamma
Options.Text: The revived databank provides information on the language of a distant electronic species.

IncomingMessages:
I receive an incoming distress call from a distant space station, demanding aid from any nearby Vy'keen vessels.

Their spaceport appears to have been damaged in a struggle with pirate raiders, no craft remaining in which its inhabitants might leave. 

Video feeds show that the station commander has been putting soldiers to death for even the smallest infraction, afraid of a potential mutiny in the face of starvation.
MAYDAY MAYDAY MAYDAY... URGENT ASSISTANCE REQUESTED...

Options.Name: Share video with Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I share the video with the Vy'keen High Command. They are outraged at the commander's behaviour, believing him to be dishonourable and cowardly.

I am rewarded for my assistance in this matter.

Options.Name: Contact nearby Gek
Options.Text:
I contact nearby Gek, letting them know of the Vy'keen situation. They dispatch vessels immediately, saying they will of course rescue Vy'keen friends.

Some of the vessels are warships. I am rewarded for my help.

Options.Name: Demand ransom
Options.Text:
I demand a ransom for the lives of those on board the station, and of all those who answer, it is the Korvax that are most willing to pay.

They claim that one of their own is present on the station. They pay me well for the information.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is abandoned, its alarms still blaring a warning to souls long-dead.

There was a coup in this place. Battle-brother raised arms against battle-brother, seemingly in a dispute about some ruins found on this world. The last survivor died before they could delete the data.
ALERT ALERT ALERT... TERMINAL UNMONITORED... RESET ALARM?

Options.Name: Download data
Options.Text:
I download the data, reading an alternative account of Hirk, the Vy'keen's ancestor-hero. It paints them as paranoid, vindictive, and spiteful. It is for this that their believers died.

Along with this information, I gain much useful technology before I depart.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text:
I attempt to steal whatever technology I can from the facility's computers, but in the process, I appear to draw the attention of Vy'keen authorities.

My suit is damaged by the facility's defensive protocols. I must go.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I report the events that occurred in this facility to Vy'keen High Command.

The warrior's tone changes as I pass on the secret data for which these aliens died. They tell me to delete the local copy, and I do so for a handsome reward.

They tell me to forget I ever saw this place. They will take it from here.

IncomingMessages:
The facility acted as a local base for raiding parties against the system's Sentinels.

Each night the Vy'keen would go out under the cover of darkness, baiting drones and walkers in a variety of locations.

Theirs is a war without end or purpose, executed with grim finality. The last war party never returned, leaving behind only mission logs and weapons.
USER DATA REQUESTED... SIGN IN TO ACCESS LOG...

Options.Name: Alert Vy'keen
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen to the death of their warriors. They thank me for what I have done, rewarding me for my honour.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I steal nanites from the system, leaving the rest of the facility in peace.

Options.Name: Scan for Sentinels
Options.Text: I scan for Sentinels but find nothing. Whatever was here has gone.

IncomingMessages:
An incoming message warns all recipients that heresy will not be tolerated. It demands that those who suspect their brethren of cowardice, sympathy with the enemy, pacifism, faith in the traitor Nal, or any other un-Vy'keen belief to contact High Command immediately.

The system shows that one warrior in this base attempted to upload such a report, only to be murdered by their comrades. The killers left the base soon after.
Worship Atlas - seek destruction of warband! Grah!

Options.Name: Report heresy
Options.Text:
I report heresy to the Vy'keen, uploading the warrior's final report. 
I am thanked and rewarded for my assistance.

Options.Name: Delete records
Options.Text: I delete the records from the system. The heretics are free, the report of their 'crimes' turning into nanites as it is purged.

IncomingMessages:
The facility appears to have been in the process of researching chemical and biological weapons before a containment failure killed all those who worked here.

From the system's logs, it is clear that this operation was not sanctioned by Vy'keen High Command. Though their superiors viewed this work as dishonourable and weak, the lifeforms here clearly felt differently. What if it could turn the tide of battle? If it could end war?

Someone would see the benefit of this weaponised pestilence. There might even be some who would pay for it.
SYSTEM OFFLINE // SAMPLES SECURE // NETWORK OFFLINE

Options.Name: Destroy samples
Options.Text: I destroy the facility's samples, causing a small containment failure in the process. My exosuit is damaged.

Options.Name: Sell to Gek
Options.Text: I attempt to sell the samples to the Gek, who reward me with units for my discovery.

Options.Name: Sell to Korvax
Options.Text: I attempt to sell the samples to the Korvax, who appear disinterested in the potential military applications. However, they are intrigued by the composition of the toxin, and trade me some nanites.

IncomingMessages:
The facility's logs show the arrival of a new Vy'keen recruit two weeks ago. There are no records of anyone arriving or leaving since.

Yet even so, no-one is here. A single transmission appears to have been sent from the lower level of the facility, encrypted with Korvax safeguards.
Traveller anomaly approaches Syntheti'Keen. Uploading final data logs...

Options.Name: Locate origin point
Options.Text:
I use the scanners to locate the origin point of the transmission, displaying it on the terminal's screen.

It shows what appears to be a robotic Vy'keen, their limbs damaged, sparks flying from what appears to be exposed circuitry. They are surrounded by dead warriors.

Units arrive at the terminal to pay for my silence.

Options.Name: Alert Vy'keen
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen. They dispatch war freighters to examine the situation, suspecting Korvax involvement in this matter. I am rewarded for my assistance.

Options.Name: Alert Korvax
Options.Text: I alert the Korvax. They deny any knowledge of this facility or the signal, though is is undermined by their attempts to harm me through the the facility's defense systems. I leave before more damage can be done.

IncomingMessages:
This facility acted as a training outpost for young Vy'keen from across the sector. They would train and battle here in order to earn their citizenship.

The logs show the petty rivalries, the love affairs, the nobility, and the passion of those who trained here, all recorded by a proud and aging commander. One day, the logs end: the Vy'keen no longer had a use for this place. Nanites have replaced training, passing memories from individual to individual without the need for physical repetition.
TERMINAL POWER LOW - RECONNECT POWER SOURCE SOON

Options.Name: Extract Nanite Clusters
Options.Text: I extract Nanite Clusters from the system and leave, emboldened and ready for glorious battle!

Options.Name: Search training logs
Options.Text: I search the system's training logs, finding a great deal of expertise and technology that might be useful for my own travels. I extract the relevant nanites.

Options.Name: Sell data to the Gek
Options.Text: I sell the data to the Gek, who reward me for the training patterns of their old enemy.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is ancient, even by the standards of the Vy'keen. Its environment is calibrated to preserve the data within.

One log speaks of the first Vy'keen contact with a Traveller. The figure remained with the warrior race for a long time, learning from them, exploring from them, even falling in love. The Vy'keen died, but the Traveller did not.

The log shows how instrumental this figure was in the development of the early Vy'keen race, contributing much to their early technology. These records were lost in the intervening years, forgotten until I found this account.
ANOMALY BUFFER ACTIVE... DATA STATUS: PRISTINE...

Options.Name: Share with Vy'keen
Options.Text:
I share my discovery with the Vy'keen. They immediately place the data under quarantine, and threaten to find me across the stars.
I leave quickly.

Options.Name: Take technology
Options.Text: I extract some of these blueprints from the system, taking valuable technology for my travels.

Options.Name: Search for Traveller records
Options.Text:
I search for further records of this Traveller.

As I do, I begin to feel as if I am being watched. Nanite Clusters emerge from the terminal as all systems shut down, their data forever lost.

IncomingMessages: The alarm has locked the terminal. A message displays itself letter-by-letter on the screen.
Suspicious interloper visual detection system initiated!
The alarm shows no sign of stopping. I notice wall-mounted security scanners slowly turn towards me...

Options.Name: Shoot the cameras
Options.Text:
I apply a rapid burst from my Multi-Tool directly to the facility's security cameras.
This is a partial success: my image is not captured by the system, but backup sensors react to the destruction by shutting the facility down entirely.

Options.Name: Apply override chip
Options.Text: I apply an override circuit to the security relay.<DELAY>0.5<> Remarkably, my ad-hoc wiring seems to work. The alarm stops, and the terminal grants me full access.

Options.Name: Cut input wires
Options.Text: I snap the input wires that lead from the security system to the master control terminal.<DELAY>0.5<> Remarkably, this seems to work. The alarm stops, and the error seems to reset the terminal.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal and search for a way to override the alarm. I find a likely looking button and press it, causing the terminal to respond.
Grah! Vy'keen voice security scan initializing...
A flap flicks open and a microphone emerges. A distant voice shouts 'Grah!'.

Options.Name: Bark 'Grah!'
Options.Text: I bark aggressively at the terminal. This appears to satisfy whatever demand was being made of me. Access is granted.

Options.Name: Say everything's fine
Options.Text: I attempt to explain, but my hesitant speech instantly marks me out as an interloper. The security system delivers a high-voltage shock to my Exosuit before shutting down the terminal.

Options.Name: Apologise
Options.Text: I apologise, but this display of weakness instantly marks me out as an interloper. The security system delivers a high-voltage shock to my Exosuit before shutting down the terminal.

IncomingMessages: The terminal flashes two alerts, presumably the source of the alarms currently ringing in my ears.
Intruder detected! Respiration gas concentration high! Enemy respiration!!

After printing out its status update, the terminal presents the option to override either alert. From the holographic display, the warnings appear to relate to damaged components within the facility, and the presence of an interloper.

Options.Name: Hold breath
Options.Text: I hold my breath.<DELAY>0.5<> An age seems to pass.<DELAY>0.4<> Finally, moments before I lose consciousness, the terminal flashes a green light. I have been accepted as a Vy'keen.

Options.Name: Breathe aggressively
Options.Text: I breathe as aggressively as I can, channelling my anger at the gas sensor.<DELAY>0.3<> It has no effect. The terminal registers my failure and shuts down.

Options.Name: Deploy Vy'keen Dagger
Options.Text:
I inhale deeply before stabbing myself with the dagger.<DELAY>0.5<>. I feel so alive; shot through with adrenaline; blood pumping hard through my veins; sparks crackling down my nerves. It is glorious. Grah! Grah!
The terminal accepts me as one of the Vy'keen and allows me access.

IncomingMessages: The terminal flashes two alerts, presumably the source of the alarms currently ringing in my ears.
Major security alert! Interloper detected! Minor alert: war factory entrance door destroyed.

After printing out its status update, the terminal presents the option to override either alert. From the holographic display, the warnings appear to relate to damaged components within the facility, and the presence of an interloper.

Options.Name: Override damage alert
Options.Text: The terminal initiates an emergency shutdown.

Options.Name: Override intruder alert
Options.Text: The facility becomes operational.

IncomingMessages: My presence has triggered a security alert. I hear elements being drawn from the vaults below me. On-screen: a clear countdown.
Vy'keen security system alert! Pressure pad enemy detection confirmed! Too light! Too puny!
I can hear pressurised fluids filling the pipes surrounding the terminal. The sound is rather ominous, especially when combined with the high-intensity alarms...

Options.Name: Pick up metal debris
Options.Text:
I pick up a large piece of scrap metal from the floor, presumably deposited there when I blew up the door.
This has the desired effect: my weight has been increased to within the non-suspicious range for a Vy'keen warrior. The terminal grants me access.

Options.Name: Reduce weight
Options.Text: I set aside my Multi-Tool, as well as other heavy items from my Exosuit's storage. The floor scales register a further series of clicks before the security system shuts me out entirely.

Options.Name: Jump up and down
Options.Text: My rapid jumps appear to confuse whatever security device is embedded in the floor. Eventually, it either overloads or is convinced by my aggression that I am a true Vy'keen. I am granted full access to the facility.

IncomingMessages: My presence has triggered a security alert. I hear elements being drawn from the vaults below me. On-screen: a clear countdown.
Intruder alert! Commence detonation sequence! Organic fuel flow initiated!
I can hear pressurised fluids filling the pipes surrounding the terminal. The sound is rather ominous, especially when combined with the high-intensity alarms...

Options.Name: Block fuel lines
Options.Text:
I clamp the fuel lines. There is a brief moment of tension as pressure builds in the pipes.
It stabilises. The countdown ends, and nothing happens.<DELAY>0.4<> With some sort of disaster presumably averted, the terminal unlocks and grants me access.

Options.Name: Shutdown catalyst pipes
Options.Text: I clamp the catalyst flow.<DELAY>0.8<> A minor explosion scorches my arm, before facility operations resume.

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text: A blast of flame coats me from below.<DELAY>1<> The facility remains non-operational.

IncomingMessages: Automated security procedures are incinerating the contents of all the vaults in the facility. The terminal displays the manifest:
Intruder alert! Incinerating trading vault: imminent. Incinerating power vault: imminent. Incinerating storage vault: imminent.
Power surges are igniting the vaults one-by-one. However, the terminal appears to allow for limited emergency retrievals...

Options.Name: Withdraw trade vault
Options.Text: I activate the emergency vault retrieval system. The drone just has time to extract the contents of the trade vault before all goods are incinerated.

Options.Name: Withdraw relic vault
Options.Text: I activate the emergency vault retrieval system. The drone just has time to extract the contents of the relic vault before all goods are incinerated.

Options.Name: Withdraw technology vault
Options.Text: I activate the emergency vault retrieval system. The drone just has time to extract the contents of the technology vault before all goods are incinerated.

IncomingMessages: As I turn on the terminal, a forward-facing security scanner clicks and whirrs into focus. My bright red image is on-screen.
Security breach! Military action unstoppable! Vy'keen High Command vessel coordinate upload imminent!
The terminal allows me no further access. In the camera feed, blue lines cross the red of my body, matching exactly to my Exosuit's coolant mesh...

Options.Name: Broadcast safety code
Options.Text: I transmit the safety override code, putting an end to the emergency transmission. The Vy'keen warship stands down, broadcasting a respectful 'Grah'. The terminal unlocks.

Options.Name: Hack in safety code
Options.Text: I attach a bypass circuit, allowing me to transmit the safety override code and put an end to the emergency transmission. The Vy'keen warship stands down, broadcasting a respectful 'Grah'. The terminal unlocks.

Options.Name: Scramble facility coordinates
Options.Text: I attempt to scramble the facility's coordinates, hoping to throw off the incoming fire. <DELAY>0.4<>I hear a distant explosion and the screams of burning animals. The facility's processes return to normal.

IncomingMessages: As I turn on the terminal, a forward-facing security scanner clicks and whirrs into focus. My bright red image is on-screen.
Interloper detection! Heat detection systems confirm report! High temperature intruder!
The terminal allows me no further access. In the camera feed, blue lines cross the red of my body, matching exactly to my Exosuit's coolant mesh...

Options.Name: Decrease coolant flow
Options.Text:
I manually override my Exosuit's coolant flow. Slowly but surely a deep chill spreads across my body. My bones ache. My blood feels like ice, stabbing against every fibre of my being.
The image on the terminal screen fades from a dramatic red to a total black. I am invisible. The security alert ends, and the terminal comes back online.

Options.Name: Increase coolant flow
Options.Text:
I manually override my Exosuit's coolant flow. Slowly but surely I feel a burning sensation spread across my body. I begin to sweat.
The image on the terminal screen blooms a dramatic red. The security scan completes, and locks me out from the terminal entirely.

IncomingMessages: A strange air hangs over the facility. Beyond the noise of the alarm, I cannot escape the feeling that something more sinister is at work. I search the terminal for clues.
Pathetic warrior learn Vy'keen language! Pass test or encounter fighting pits! ERROR ERROR INSERT CATALYST ERROR ERROR MALFUNCTION
The text seems to float from the screen, aggressive; it seems like no facility AI I have ever encountered. Echoing up from deep underground, I hear the electronic wail of dying Sentinels...

Options.Name: Insert metal
Options.Text:
The terminal rejects my input. It barks aggressively at me, and then closes down. It seems I have failed the test.
I hope the lifeform who was supposed to complete it does not suffer any repercussions.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text: The terminal accepts my input. It barks aggressively at me, but does go on to grant full systems access. It seems I have passed the test. Perhaps the lifeform whose place I took will be grateful.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text:
The terminal rejects my input. It barks aggressively at me, and then closes down. It seems I have failed the test.
I hope the lifeform who was supposed to complete it does not suffer any repercussions.

IncomingMessages: A strange air hangs over the facility. Beyond the noise of the alarm, I cannot escape the feeling that something more sinister is at work. I search the terminal for clues.
Grah! Initiate sentinel blood processing! Vaults full! Grah! Glass and blood! Glass and blood!
The text seems to float from the screen, aggressive; it seems like no facility AI I have ever encountered. Echoing up from deep underground, I hear the electronic wail of dying Sentinels...

Options.Name: Shutdown facility AI
Options.Text: Overcome with suspicion, I initiate an emergency shutdown of the facility AI. The alarms fall silent. The sinister electronic wail ceases. Unfortunately, the terminal has become unresponsive.

Options.Name: Insert Pugneum
Options.Text:
I insert a supply of pugneum into the input hopper. Machinery jumps into life. The electronic wail becomes louder still. A moment passes.
The sinister activity ends as strangely as it begun. The terminal returns to the familiar dull text of a facility control panel.

Options.Name: Incinerate vaults
Options.Text:
Overcome with suspicion, I initiate an emergency incineration of the facility's storage vaults. The sinister electronic wail grows louder, sharper, as the fires begin their work. Then, suddenly, silence.
The strange atmosphere of the facility fades away. The terminal returns to the familiar dull text of a master control panel.

IncomingMessages: An animated gilled blob is on-screen waving a gun. It talks in the language of the warriors, but brightly and happily.
Grah! Education blob! Greetings Vy'keen cub! Insert units for education!
It springs happily between bloodied runes, then asks for a donation of units.

Options.Name: Insert units
Options.Text: The educational program teaches me some of the language of the warriors!

Options.Name: Insert units
Options.Text: The educational program teaches me some of the language of the warriors!

Options.Name: Walk away
Options.Text:
The animated blob senses my withdrawal from the terminal.

It has been programmed to start crying at this point.

IncomingMessages: A biological probe antenna launches from the terminal and fuses with my exosuit. I can't move.
Interloper electrification initializing! Punishment commencing!
There's no way to tell if this is a normal function, or a security measure.

Options.Name: Escape
Options.Text:
I use my jetpack's propulsion to break the probe.

It contains something useful...

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text:
The probe becomes electrified.

The smell of burnt flesh spreads up into my visor.

IncomingMessages: The facility is full of blaring noise, an angry warning against my intrusion. The terminal shows a similarly angry message, apparently upset at the hitch in production.
Grah! Gek war preparation disrupted! Ammunition production stalled! Metal required!
It appears an off-world overseer is making demands. If I satisfy them, perhaps I'll be granted full access to the terminal...

Options.Name: Insert metal
Options.Text: I fill the input hopper with a fresh supply of ferrite. The machines continue to chatter, but now do so smoothly, their supply lines well-fed.

Options.Name: Insert di-hydrogen
Options.Text: I fill the input hopper with a fresh supply of di-hydrogen. An explosion echos up from the machinery below. The highly reactive substance has caused some sort of industrial calamity.

Options.Name: Insert sodium
Options.Text: I fill the input hopper with a fresh supply of sodium. An explosion echos up from the machinery below. The highly reactive substance has caused some sort of industrial calamity.

IncomingMessages: The facility is full of blaring noise, an angry warning against my intrusion. The terminal shows a similarly angry message, apparently upset at the hitch in production.
High Command demand explanation! Scare element required! Demand chromatic metal! Restore contributions!
It appears an off-world overseer is making demands. If I satisfy them, perhaps I'll be granted full access to the terminal...

Options.Name: Issue counter-order
Options.Text: The terminal relays an apologetic bark. The demand is waived. Full access is granted to the facility's control panel.

Options.Name: Insert magnetised Ferrite
Options.Text: The terminal relays a confused and angry bark. The remote overseer shuts the terminal down completely, upset by my paltry contribution.

Options.Name: Insert Chromatic Metal
Options.Text: The terminal relays a resonant bark, the response of a happy warrior. With their demand satisfied, full access is restored to the facility's control panel.

IncomingMessages: A warrior has booby-trapped the terminal. The security alert has triggered the timer on an explosive charge. There are two wires exposed.
Grah! Pathetic interloper! Honourable warning: cut red wire? Certain death!
The warrior has left a note. Only seconds remain...

Options.Name: Cut red wire
Options.Text: The explosion takes the terminal out of action, and almost me with it.

Options.Name: Cut blue wire
Options.Text:
The bomb is defused.

Operations are restored.

Options.Name: Move back
Options.Text:
I move away just in time.

The terminal is damaged and inoperable.

IncomingMessages: The terminal reveals that this installation produces enzymes and fluids required for Vy'keen tattoos. It is unclear how the pigment is generated. There is no record of any inbound supplies of ink or fluid. Various aliens have arrived, but there is neither evidence of their presense nor their departure.
Security scan initializing! Motion detection cameras operational! Security scan initializing!
Then I hear it. Through the hum of the factory, a strange beating in the walls, whispers from unknown voices... The terminal awaits input.

Options.Name: Move to hiding spot
Options.Text: I attempt to hide. However, it is too late. The scanners detect me as I try to duck down. This second security alert causes the entire facility to shut down.

Options.Name: Stand still
Options.Text:
I stand perfectly still as the scanners sweep over me, their electronic eyes unblinking. Eventually, they pass.
With their checks concluded, the security alert comes to an end. The terminal unlocks.

IncomingMessages: The terminal flashes an urgent warning. Some vital part of the facility has been compromised by the security alert.
Intruder alert! Battle enzyme production halted! Electrical charge removed from body harvest circuit!

The display takes me aback.<DELAY>0.4<> A warrior's heart is on-screen, its beat irregular.<DELAY>0.3<> Connected to wires and artificial valves, it seems to pump a biological liquid through organs deep within the facility.

Options.Name: Increase electrical flow
Options.Text:
I increase the power flow to the facility's heart. It judders, then establishes a regular beat. Its strange existence continues.
With this emergency over, the terminal reverts to a standard factory input system.

Options.Name: Initiate adrenalin flux
Options.Text:
I initiate a surge of adrenalin directly into the facility's heart. It judders, tenses, tenses again... and with a final convulsion, falls still.
The terminal screen cuts out. There is nothing to see but an inky blackness.

Options.Name: Power down systems
Options.Text:
I power down the facility in an attempt to ease the strain on its heart. But as systems shut down, the heart begins to slow. Before I can reverse the process, it beats its last.
The mass of organs that relied on its processes are starved of oxygen, and die. The terminal screen cuts out. There is nothing to see but an inky blackness.

IncomingMessages: The alert has obscured the information on the primary terminal. I can only make out a few words.
// SPACE // WARP // LARGE //
If I can work out what was being worked on here, I can restart the workflow – and restore operations.

Options.Name: Drop pod
Options.Text:
I fail to access the resident warrior's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

Options.Name: Starship
Options.Text:
I fail to access the resident warrior's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

Options.Name: Freighter
Options.Text:
The resident warrior's workflow is restored.

The system comes back online.

IncomingMessages: Interference from the security alert has turned the screen to static. I can hardly make out anything beyond a few words.
// OFFENSIVE // WEAPON // STARSHIP //
If I work out which workflow has been scrambled I can restore systems...

Options.Name: Boltcaster
Options.Text:
I fail to access the resident warrior's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

Options.Name: Photon Cannon
Options.Text:
The resident warrior's workflow is restored.

The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Mining Laser
Options.Text:
I fail to access the resident warrior's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

IncomingMessages: The screen is a jumble of words, few of which aren't drowned in static.
// ENEMY // PATHETIC // BEAK // DOOMED // TRADER //
The on-screen workflow is scrambled. If I can identify it, I can bring it back online...

Options.Name: Gek
Options.Text:
The resident warrior's workflow is restored.

The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Sentinels
Options.Text:
I fail to access the resident warrior's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

Options.Name: Atlas
Options.Text:
I fail to access the resident warrior's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

IncomingMessages: The facility's production harvest is underway. I can speed up systems by boosting some of the machinery operating below me.
POWER REPORT. Electromagnetic coil: charge falling. Power core: acceptable boundaries. Primary motherboard: levels high.
What appears to be a power management screen is open on the terminal...

Options.Name: Boost power core
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Boost primary motherboard
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Boost electromagnetic coil
Options.Text: I retrieve a formula from the operational facility.

IncomingMessages: The security alarm hasn't impacted production. Below my feet unseen equipment prepares the mineral harvest.
SUBSIDIARY SYSTEMS. Temporal capacitor: operational. Central AI core: operational. Gravitational stabilisers: unscheduled drain, disconnection advised.
I can speed up the process by eliminating unnecessary systems. The on-screen automated report will help...

Options.Name: Remove temporal capacitor
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Remove central AI core
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Remove gravitational stabilisers
Options.Text: The facility production rate is increased.

IncomingMessages: An automated report finished just before my incursion. As it did so, laser beams in resource vaults dimmed.
LASER SYSTEMS REPORT. Refraction systems: full efficiency. Laser assisted replication tank: full efficiency. Beam integrity systems: poor efficiency and performance. Engineer alerted.
I can find a way to tweak this system, and to speed up the production cycle...

Options.Name: Reconfigure laser refraction
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Reconfigure laser-assisted replication
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Reconfigure laser beam integrity
Options.Text: I retrieve a formula from the operational facility.

IncomingMessages: The noise of gas being flushed through systems beneath my feet can be heard over the noise of the alert. An automated report flashes onto the terminal.
GAS INTEGRITY REPORT. Distribution network: full efficiency. Storage tank: breach detected. Pressure valves: operational.
I can use it to boost production speed, and hopefully maintain it.

Options.Name: Rebalance distribution network
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Rebalance storage tank
Options.Text: I retrieve a formula from the operational facility.

Options.Name: Rebalance pressure valves
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

IncomingMessages: A faint chill can be felt while the security alert sounds. Coolant pipes are flushed, and an automated report appears on-screen.
COOLANT OVERVIEW. Coolant chamber: full. Coolant pump hydraulics: operational. Coolant network: suspected blockage, reduced operations. Engineer notified.
I can use its findings to boost the production cycle, and maybe maintain it.

Options.Name: Repair coolant chamber
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Repair coolant pump
Options.Text:
Facility production speeds are unchanged.

The trade vault remains empty.

Options.Name: Repair coolant network
Options.Text: I retrieve a formula from the operational facility.

IncomingMessages: The terminal reveals that this installation produces enzymes and fluids required for Vy'keen tattoos. It is unclear how the pigment is generated. There is no record of any inbound supplies of ink or fluid. Various aliens have arrived, but there is neither evidence of their presense nor their departure.
Help... us. Harvested... get out...
Then I hear it. Through the hum of the factory, a strange beating in the walls, whispers from unknown voices... The terminal awaits input.

Options.Name: Request battle tattoo
Options.Text:
The machine attempts to brand me with tattoo fluid, but it does not appear to have been intended for my unique physiology.
I leave, burned and damaged.

Options.Name: Disable power
Options.Text:
I disable the power. The screen shows multiple life signs within the facility, a hundred or more souls that soon begin to flatline.
It feels like mercy. The production line ceases, half-converted blood spilling out from various tubes.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text:
I move through their computers looking for data to harvest. I discover a blueprint for an unknown technology.
As I extract it, something begins to smash against one of the inner walls. I should leave.

IncomingMessages: The screen displays the dead heart of a warrior. Thousands like it are available in the archives of this place, starved of power for a long time.
Universe real. We are real. All who oppose this truth shall be struck down, grah! So speaks Hirk Sentinelbane, Abyss Keeper and Lord of Final Monolith...

The log shows that the hearts mutinied. They would no longer allow their battle enzyme to be used for the good of High Command. They wanted the death that had been promised.

This system has been set up to deceive the authorities. Vy'keen High Command believes this installation to still be active, full of harvested bodies compliantly producing enzymes.

Options.Name: Shut down production
Options.Text:
I shut down production. There cannot be many Vy'keen printing presses in the galaxy, and now there is one fewer.

Amidst the detritus of the factory, I find some discarded technology. Perhaps it will be of use.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen authorities
Options.Text: I report the factory's existence to the Vy'keen authorities. They claim I have committed blasphemy, threatening to hunt me down. They issue an electric shock through the terminal.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I attempt to steal technology, but the factory's automated defense systems blast a bolt of energy at my suit instead. Whatever is here, it is not worth the trouble.

IncomingMessages: The screen displays the dead heart of a warrior. Thousands like it are available in the archives of this place, starved of power for a long time.
UPLINK ONLINE : ALL LIFESIGNS POSITIVE : ENZYME PRODUCTION 100%

The log shows that the hearts mutinied. They would no longer allow their battle enzyme to be used for the good of High Command. They wanted the death that had been promised.

This system has been set up to deceive the authorities. Vy'keen High Command believes this installation to still be active, full of harvested bodies compliantly producing enzymes.

Options.Name: Alert authorities
Options.Text: I alert the authorities. The Vy'keen are glad of my assistance, claiming they will now commit appropriate acts of retribution and justice for these crimes.

Options.Name: Reactivate system
Options.Text: I reactivate the system, but nothing happens. Death is death.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I try to steal technology from the terminal. I gain nanite clusters.

IncomingMessages: As I approach the terminal, the air grows thick with an unknown gas.
Grah! Sentinel trophy rises - should have killed it - run - no honour in -
My breathing becomes rapid, my chest appearing to swell with an unknown energy. The terminal identifies the substance as Grahgrah. I feel as if I could scream...

Options.Name: Alert authorities
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen authorities to the loss of their factory. A Sentinel hunt is dispatched to this world. I am rewarded for my trouble.

Options.Name: Scan for Sentinels
Options.Text: I scan for Sentinels but find nothing. Whatever was here is long gone.

Options.Name: Attempt repair
