Options.Text: I attempt to repair the breach in life support, but the system rebels and I end up receiving damage instead. I should leave. There is nothing for me here.

IncomingMessages: As I approach the terminal, the air grows thick with an unknown gas.
UNREGISTERED USER : DEPLOYING GRAHGRAH FROM EMERGENCY SUPPLY
My breathing becomes rapid, my chest appearing to swell with an unknown energy. The terminal identifies the substance as Grahgrah. I feel as if I could scream...

Options.Name: Scream
Options.Text:
I scream, not a cry of fear but a shout of battle. Gas levels begin to decrease but, nevertheless, those who created this factory observed my response.
Amused, they reward me using the terminal.

Options.Name: Fight against the impulse
Options.Text:
I fight against the impulse to scream, holding my breath and attempting to accelerate my suit's hazard protection.

As I struggle, the gas levels decrease. The terminal registers a disappointment from those who created this factory.

Options.Name: Smash the terminal
Options.Text:
I smash the terminal, causing the concentration of gas to rise and rise.

Eventually, the scream emerges uncontrollably, tearing my vocal chords as it does. The gas begins to dissipate, and all I am left with is pain and battlelust.

IncomingMessages: The factory produces components for starships, fabricating them from the resources available on this world.
Interloper! Vent energy! Increase production at once!

This installation creates parts for Vy'keen fighters. Whilst Vy'keen buildings are heavily fortified to withstand bombardment, their starcraft prioritise the speed and flexibility required for their hunts.
A video feed on the terminal shows a warning, a warrior shaking their hands wildly at a camera deep within the factory's heart.

Options.Name: Increase production speed
Options.Text:
I increase the production speed.
A message informs me that heat levels are now back within normal limits, the extra energy dissipating within the factory's depths.
The warrior rewards me with a gift, thanking me for saving their life.

Options.Name: Decrease production speed
Options.Text:
I decrease the production speed.
The warrior begins to panic, screaming as their whole body is burned by the rising heat of the overactive factory.
The video cuts off, and the factory's processes slowly grind to a halt.

Options.Name: Wave your hands back
Options.Text:
I wave my hands back at the warrior.
The warrior begins to panic, screaming as their body is burned by the rising heat of the overactive factory.
The video cuts off, the smell of smoke starting to drift through the air. I should depart.

IncomingMessages: The factory produces bladed weapons, free from any energy-based component at all.
PRODUCTION HALTED: IMMOBILE ORGANIC MATTER IN PIPE 17

The manifest suggests they are destined for ceremonial usage within the Vy'keen fleet, a reminder that the greatest death arrives when you stare your opponent in the eyes, free from technology, face to face in final combat...

Something has gone wrong. Production is blocked by foreign material.

Options.Name: Disable production line
Options.Text: I initiate a shutdown of the production line, allowing a creature to wriggle free from its machinery. The automated factory system offers me a reward.

Options.Name: Purge biological matter
Options.Text: I initiate purge of biological matter in the factory below. The terminal confirms the death of an unknown creature. The automated factory system offers me a reward.

Options.Name: Take technology
Options.Text: Ignoring the production line, I focus on the technology behind the system. I harvest several nanite clusters from the machine.

IncomingMessages: The factory appears to have ceased production long ago, its systems derelict and unused.
Do not drink the water... warriors lost... Grah! This was preventable, this -
Yet the sigil of the Vy'keen still occupies these terminals, blinking away, awaiting input. An audio log plays on loop.

Options.Name: Attempt factory reset
Options.Text: I attempt to reset the factory's systems. Nanite Clusters come pooling forth from the factory's innards. I take some with me.

Options.Name: Alert Vy'keen authorities
Options.Text: I alert the Vy'keen authorities to the loss of their factory. An inquisitorial team is dispatched to this world and I am rewarded for my trouble.

Options.Name: Take technology
Options.Text: I attempt to extract blueprints from the factory's systems, succeeding in gaining a new technology.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.

Knowledge paves the way to the understanding of probability. The Atlas spoke in fragments. The Atlas Interfaces are their shadows. The monoliths are their scattered children.

Together they convey the wisdom of the infinite. They must be understood.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.

The Atlas Interfaces drift alone in the endless void. They are silent. They are unknowable fragments of an ancient whole. Yet their imprint on time and space molds our existence. 

They are the equation, and life is its answer. Through their Monoliths they give understanding to their boundless meaning, and that of our own.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The strange stone marker imparts the wisdom of the Korvax Echoes to those who desire it. I do not know what dialect it speaks, yet somehow I understand the story of those who once worshipped here.

The Korvax Echoes tell of a time, long ago, when the Monoliths of the Atlas woke the civilizations of the Outer Edge. Their presence filled them with a desire for knowledge.

From these beginnings empires were born, spoke out and fell silent once more. An eternity that cannot be quantified passed.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.

The Atlas Interfaces await the arrival of the Travellers, those who would seek the ends of the universe through its very core. Within the infinity of time their arrival is probable.

Their potential could know no bounds. One dimension in billions will receive them.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Lights burst from the obelisk. They pass through me, each a whispered Korvax secret buried for millennia deep within its rock.

We are the Korvax Echoes, ever enduring Entities of the Convergence. We live on through the logic and wisdom passed through our metal skins.

Each generation is greater than the last.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: I hear the distant voices of the Korvax Entities who once worshipped here. As they whisper, words written in my own language glow faintly on the monument. The Echoes want to be heard...

Eheu. Before the Dark Times the entities of the Korvax worshipped the Sentinels. Through them the Convergence found the formula of enlightenment.

Now we calculate our own path, seeking to further enhance the mind of all that is one towards an understanding of the Atlas.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.

The Sentinels forbid all destruction. The Sentinels forbid Entity disconnection through violence. Theirs is a way of peace and fulfillment, of logic and probability.

They teach us that each life's value, from the smallest to that which gives life to all others, is equal.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.

For countless generations the entities of the Korvax disconnected and passed on into the Echoes naturally. Each disconnection added to the knowledge and soul of the Convergence.

Our home was Korvax Prime. Within its foundations we stored the memories of our race, an ever evolving equation that defines us.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The strange stone marker imparts the wisdom of the Korvax Echoes to those who desire it. I do not know what dialect it speaks, yet somehow I understand the story of those who once worshipped here.

Disconnection is not permanent. It is merely the start of a new equation. On Korvax Prime entities who passed on into the Korvax Echoes left their shell for their descendants.

So has been the way of the Korvax: an endless carapace cycle that knows no end.

This way will continue. It will continue for as long as our lights still shine.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.

Those within the Korvax Echoes have left the physical realm, but they endure through the masks and shells of our children.

Thoughts and knowledge ever-growing, we search for deeper understanding of the equation that defines our existence.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Lights burst from the obelisk. They pass through me, each a whispered Korvax secret buried for millennia deep within its rock.

The Korvax lived peacefully. We praised the Sentinels, learning from them, living beside them in equilibrium.

The Korvax honoured the Sentinels' ways, refusing to dig into the sacred ground they protected.

We were enlightened.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: I hear the distant voices of the Korvax Entities who once worshipped here. As they whisper, words written in my own language glow faintly on the monument. The Echoes want to be heard...

Through research and study we, the Korvax, became powerful within ourselves. The one mind Convergence flourished. Nurtured like a sapling in the light, it grew tall and mighty.

The Sentinels brought us the gift of knowledge. We gave thanks to the Atlas.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.

Eheu. Korvax Prime was watched keenly and closely by an unknown race. It lurked in the depths of the darkness. Vigilant and patient it awaited its time.

The Great Disconnection was at hand.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.

Eheu. The darkness burst forth with the force of a supernova. The Great Disconnection had begun. A hundred million Korvax voices cried out.

The Korvax Echoes became a frenzy of noise. Innumerable cycles passed before balance was restored.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The strange stone marker imparts the wisdom of the Korvax Echoes to those who desire it. I do not know what dialect it speaks, yet somehow I understand the story of those who once worshipped here.

The Great Disconnection. The masks and shells of the Korvax survivors shook with the screams of the disconnected. Lights dimmed as the enemy descended, malevolent in its intent.

Their numbers were too many. Korvax Prime was destroyed.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.

A hundred million casing lights were dimmed. The Great Disconnection destroyed all that went before. The Korvax Echoes became screams.

Years stretched like millennia amidst the disarray yet slowly hope was reborn through logic.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Lights burst from the obelisk. They pass through me, each a whispered Korvax secret buried for millennia deep within its rock.

Korvax Prime was destroyed. Its secrets spilled into an empty sky. Its fragments touched the edges of the galaxy.

Upon this destruction the Gek First Spawn aggressor built its dominion within the Outer Edge.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: I hear the distant voices of the Korvax Entities who once worshipped here. As they whisper, words written in my own language glow faintly on the monument. The Echoes want to be heard...

The First Spawn of the Gek disconnected the Korvax. Through obliteration they sought dominion. They stole our planet. Enslaved our survivors.

Their revelry made them misguided in thought and deed. Probability dictated that our time would come again.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.

The Korvax were enslaved, driven by cruelty to fulfil the despot's bidding. The First Spawn of the Gek were terrible masters, merciless in their spite, illogical in their cruelty. 

Countless entities toiled and disconnected. These tablets are the testament of those who survived.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.

Eheu. The Gek harnessed the technology of the Korvax to conquer worlds. Thieves, usurpers, false lords to the power of infinity. All who opposed their will perished.

The balance tipped towards the darkness.

These were the times of disconnection and illogical misdeeds.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The strange stone marker imparts the wisdom of the Korvax Echoes to those who desire it. I do not know what dialect it speaks, yet somehow I understand the story of those who once worshipped here.

The Gek destroyed worlds. The Sentinels struck back. The technology of the Korvax was used to destroy the machines we venerated.

There was endless disconnection. The Convergence shook with great despair.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.

The Entities of the Korvax were forced into chains of silence, but the Korvax Convergence that linked their souls could never be subdued.

It endures, forever seeking new formulas to solve the equation of eternal enlightenment. The probability of success is unknown.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Lights burst from the obelisk. They pass through me, each a whispered Korvax secret buried for millennia deep within its rock.

The Korvax Echoes within the unseen Convergence that linked our souls never relinquished love for the Atlas. As millennia passed this affection spread. The Cult of the Atlas.

The equations and probabilities the Korvax hold dear entered Gek consciousness. They had only to solve it to see the folly of their past miscalculations.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: I hear the distant voices of the Korvax Entities who once worshipped here. As they whisper, words written in my own language glow faintly on the monument. The Echoes want to be heard...

The First Spawn could not control the outer edges of their vast Empire. The Cult of the Atlas grew. It taught of harmony through insignificance.

Minds that knew only war began to question. Greed and ambition yielded to reason.

The Gek floundered. The First Spawn became conflicted and divided.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.

The First Spawn of the Gek overreached. They stretched too far. Their folly and pride knew no bounds. Again and again they tried, again and again they were repelled.

The unstoppable force of the Sentinels could not be withstood. The unbendable cannot be broken.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.

The Cult of the Atlas drew forces within the Gek to the Stations of the Atlas. The First Spawn could not prevent it. Arrogant ambition yielded to newfound reason.

Stone by stone the Gek Dominion crumbled.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The strange stone marker imparts the wisdom of the Korvax Echoes to those who desire it. I do not know what dialect it speaks, yet somehow I understand the story of those who once worshipped here.

The Gek stood in the shadow of the Atlas Interface. It did not open. It did not speak. Yet, the First Spawn felt awe. They felt their insignificance at the centre of an unending universe.

It was improbable. Yet within infinity all things remain possible. The Gek changed. The Diminishment had begun.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.

The unspeaking, unmoving Atlas Interface inflicted an insignificance upon the Gek emissaries that showed them their role within the expanse of infinity.

It forced recognition of their true place in a limitless universe.

The Gek saw their folly, their heads bowed in shame for the miscalculations they had wrought.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Lights burst from the obelisk. They pass through me, each a whispered Korvax secret buried for millennia deep within its rock.

The Cult of the Atlas took hold as the First Spawn of the Gek crumbled. The Diminishment was at its apex. Endless expansion turned to dust. Eons of aggression receded.

The Gek saw new solutions and the Korvax became free. The miscalculations of the past paved the way for the discovery of a newfound balance.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: I hear the distant voices of the Korvax Entities who once worshipped here. As they whisper, words written in my own language glow faintly on the monument. The Echoes want to be heard...

The low spawn Gek turned on their leaders. Their First Spawn were cast out, ripped from their spawning pools and cast into the dust. Their lamentations curdled the air.

The wisdom of the Korvax and the Atlas prevailed.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.

The Entities of the Korvax are free. Free to study the Atlas. Free to praise the Sentinels. Free to aid the Travellers if probability will allow.

Korvax and Gek would begin anew, equal in standing, united in the eternal search for balance and understanding.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.

The coming of the Travellers is possible, as all things are. Yet the chances are infinitesimal. We watch the skies nonetheless.

If they do not come here, they will exist elsewhere and our kind – or a kind like us will welcome them.

Within the chaos of the infinite we must cling to the probable.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The strange stone marker imparts the wisdom of the Korvax Echoes to those who desire it. I do not know what dialect it speaks, yet somehow I understand the story of those who once worshipped here.

All things must happen. All things will occur. Somewhere, elsewhere or as a part of the hereafter.

Now ends the testament of the Korvax.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages: The historical structure is silent.<NEWLINE>The Testament of the Korvax has been voiced.

Options.Name: Seek help with language
Options.Text: My knowledge of the Korvax Convergence increases.

IncomingMessages:
I stand at the terminal and watch a beacon from an unknown star endlessly play itself out on the screen.

The pattern seems clear, but what to enter?

Options.Name: Input: 7238
Options.Text:
The observatory does not get a response from the infinite and unimaginable space above it.

I am quite alone.

Options.Name: Input: 8273
Options.Text: I discover a location within the distant stars!

Options.Name: Input: 3278
Options.Text:
The observatory does not get a response from the infinite and unimaginable space above it.

I am quite alone.

IncomingMessages:
A beacon flickers on screen, received from a distant point in space.

My fingers hover above the terminal, ready to enter the code to reveal the location, but what numbers do I enter?

Options.Name: Input: 8039
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's origin remains unknown.

Options.Name: Input: 0839
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's origin remains unknown.

Options.Name: Input: 8390
Options.Text:
I enter the digits and wait.

The location of a distant point in space is revealed to me.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory's sterile, functional layout suggests its former overseer could have been electronic in origin. Judging by the decades-old beacon flashing on screen, this entity left this place long ago.
 
Perhaps if I can decipher the code I can learn where the beacon originated?

Options.Name: Input: 6192
Options.Text:
My attempts prove futile.

The dark void above sends no response to my code.

Options.Name: Input: 2916
Options.Text:
Success.

I learn of a new location in the cosmos.

Options.Name: Input: 1962
Options.Text:
My attempts prove futile.

The dark void above sends no response to my code.

IncomingMessages:
The image of the observatory's former electronic overseer flickers on the console next to the flash of the beacon indicator. I wonder how long it waited to receive such a signal from an unknown part of space?

Perhaps I can send the reply the overseer never could. But first I must decipher the code.

Options.Name: Input: 3653
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's secret remains unknown to me.

Options.Name: Input: 3566
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's secret remains unknown to me.

Options.Name: Input: 6533
Options.Text:
The stars reveal their secret.

I have discovered a new world within the infinite void.

IncomingMessages:
The facility is more like a science lab than an observatory, the star gazing equipment sitting amidst a sea of advanced experiments.
 
Perhaps the former custodian was too preoccupied to notice the beacon blinking invitingly on screen. If I can work out the code, I'm sure I can decipher its origin.

Options.Name: Input: 6436
Options.Text:
Success.
 
I punch in the numbers and the beacon reveals the location of a new location within the cosmos.

Options.Name: Input: 4663
Options.Text: I punch in the numbers but the beacon does not divulge its secret.

Options.Name: Input: 3643
Options.Text: I punch in the numbers but the beacon does not divulge its secret.

IncomingMessages:
I stand at the terminal as tiny drones go about a series of perfunctory cleaning routines within this pristine observatory. Clearly the former overseer was a stickler for cleanliness, but perhaps less conscientious about monitoring incoming communications from distant reaches of space. 
 
A beacon blinks invitingly on the monitor. If I can enter the correct access code perhaps I could make a valuable discovery.

Options.Name: Input: 3547
Options.Text:
The code is incorrect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

Options.Name: Input: 4735
Options.Text:
The code is correct.

The beacon's mystery is revealed to me.

Options.Name: Input: 3574
Options.Text:
The code is incorrect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory is ancient, its logs revealing that it predates most of the galaxy's known history.

It was apparently once built for and inhabited by the Korvax, but this must be an error. The life support systems are calibrated for biological lifeforms...

Nothing remains now but a beacon blinking upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 6538
Options.Text: I discover a location within the distant stars!

Options.Name: Input: 5638
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's origin remains unknown.

Options.Name: Input: 3568
Options.Text:
The observatory does not get a response from the infinite and unimaginable space above it.

I am quite alone.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory appears to have been calibrated for a single purpose: to locate the interfaces of a being the Korvax call the Atlas.

After many years, the inhabitant of this facility succeeded in their quest, disappearing without a trace.

And, over time, the systems reset to their default search pattern. A beacon blinks upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 1652
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's origin remains unknown.

Options.Name: Input: 2561
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's secret remains unknown to me.

Options.Name: Input: 2651
Options.Text:
I enter the digits and wait.

The location of a distant point in space is revealed to me.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory appears to have boosted the transmissions of the alien Korvax. 

Their Convergence used this place to determine the locations of fallen bodies for retrieval. Their species values the suits of the lost.

One such beacon blinks upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 2833
Options.Text:
My attempts prove futile.

The dark void above sends no response to my code.

Options.Name: Input: 3823
Options.Text:
The code is correct.

The beacon's mystery is revealed to me.

Options.Name: Input: 3832
Options.Text:
My attempts prove futile.

The dark void above sends no response to my code.

IncomingMessages:
The observatory appears to have functioned as a battle station for the Korvax, coordinating defensive craft across a dozen systems.

The sensors mark the arrival of Gek fighter ships in the atmosphere many years ago. The station has been unmanned since that day.

Nothing remains but a beacon blinking upon the screen, a code needed to decipher its point of origin...

Options.Name: Input: 2302
Options.Text:
Success.
 
I punch in the numbers and the beacon reveals the location of a new location within the cosmos.

Options.Name: Input: 2320
Options.Text:
There is no response.

The beacon's secret remains unknown to me.

Options.Name: Input: 0322
Options.Text:
The code is incorrect.

The beacon's origin remains a mystery.

IncomingMessages: I'm inspecting the monolith's surface when I am seized by a strange vision. Its words echo in my skull.
Calm, child. Calm. We are with you.

I feel faint, as if my mind is being invaded. Pustules on my skin grow, bubble and pop - and I feel countless tiny stabbing pin-pricks scrabbling from each gaping hole.
 
Suddenly metal spiders, perhaps tiny Sentinels, run up my shoulder and into my visor. Can this be real? This CANNOT be real. I start to scream.

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text: The hallucination fades. I have passed some sort of test. A reward materialises.

Options.Name: Fire weapon
Options.Text: The hold on my mind is shattered when I strike the monolith. Reality is restored, though I hear a lingering whisper, a displeasure at my actions.

Options.Name: Remove helmet and scrape away spiders
Options.Text: The metal spiders enter my skull, and I rip off my helmet in panic. The hallucination fades. The pain does not.

IncomingMessages: As I look upon the ancient relic, a strange feeling grips hold of me. My vision begins to swim. I am here, but not here.
Korvax Echoes will advance the Traveller. Korvax Echoes will advance Traveller's technology.

Tiny floating tetrahedrons emerge from the planet's surface and surround me. I try to wave them away with my Multi-Tool, but each time they swarm closer to it - as if attracted to it somehow.

I raise my Multi-Tool, and they shimmer blue as they dart this way and that. Closer and closer. They are within touching distance of my Multi-Tool. They make one final surge...

Options.Name: Let the tetrahedrons in
Options.Text:
My Multi-Tool glows bright blue. The colour spreads, seeping up my arm. With a sudden surge, the electric glow reaches my brain. I pass out.
I awake. Reality is restored. I find myself in possession of a new piece of Multi-Tool technology.

Options.Name: Escape the tetrahedron cloud
Options.Text:
The sharp edges of the floating objects rip holes in my Exosuit. I gasp, and inhale the crystals. They flood my lungs. My vision goes blue...
I awake. Reality is restored.

IncomingMessages: My fingers rest on the cool stone of the monolith. Suddenly, I am seized. An ancient vision floods through me.
Past is dead. Reconstruction impossible. Resist. Resist.

Blue light pours from the monolith as if a curtain has been dropped within. I hear a gentle hubbub of voices, and catch a familiar smell on the breeze. I cannot remember my home, but I know that this doorway leads there.

I ache for a past I cannot remember. Every inch of my soul wants to make the leap back. I look to the skies, and the infinity beyond. Can I truly abandon my journey, when it's only just begun?

Options.Name: Step back into the past
Options.Text: The portal slips shut as soon as I make a move. <DELAY>0.4<> I feel the pity of the spirits that live in this place.

Options.Name: Resist temptation
Options.Text: I try to capture a memory of these sensations, before turning away. <DELAY>0.4<> The spirits that dwell here admire my decision. I am rewarded.

IncomingMessages: I touch my hands to the strange polished stone of the monolith. Images flood into my head, words and scenes screamed from another age.
Past is dead. Youth is over. Only the traveller journey remains.

A child emerges from the monolith. It takes a few moments before I realise that... it's me. I look carefree and innocent. The little one stares up at my Exosuit, and tries to see me through my visor.

The child suddenly starts to weep, and clings to my knees. They implore me never to leave. They don't want to be alone. I should stay here forever. We should be reunited. Whole again once more.

Options.Name: Stay
Options.Text: The child withdraws and shakes its head.<DELAY>0.4<> I try to embrace it.<DELAY>0.4<> It turns to dust.

Options.Name: Comfort, then leave
Options.Text: The child understands. We embrace.<DELAY>0.4<> It leaves me with a gift.

Options.Name: Leave
Options.Text: The child wails. It can't understand my decision.<DELAY>0.4<> The monolith looks down upon us in silent judgement.

IncomingMessages: I begin to feel dizzy. A strange lethargy comes over me, and I feel compelled to lie down in front of the ancient relic. This place feels calming. It feels like home, wherever that might have once been.
Sleep, child. Korvax Echoes bless you. Sleep. Sleep.
I know that if I truly wanted to fight the impulse to sleep I probably could, but I feel warm and comfortable basking in the glow of the ancient runes...

Options.Name: Sleep
Options.Text:
I sleep.
When I awake, I am reinvigorated. I have no notion of how long I slept. Moments? Hours? Days? The sensation is extraordinary. I feel like a new person.

Options.Name: Resist
Options.Text:
I resist the command of the monolith. My eyes will not close.
After a moment of struggle, the power of the great stone fades. I am in control.
As I leave, I hear a sad, soft whisper on the breeze.

IncomingMessages: The stone whispers as I approach, cool blue words that sparkle in the air, unmistakable and ancient. I am transported into a strange new reality.
Korvax Echoes command: reward yourself.

A flickering reflection of my own body emerges from a portal. It mimics every move I make. When I wave, it waves. When I raise my Multi-Tool, it copies instantly. The doppelganger makes a motion to suggest it wants something, and we both recoil when I realise I've instinctively matched its movements.

Its body shimmers, but its equipment looks somehow real. Its Multi-Tool looks better than my own. The dimensional irregularity is fading.

Options.Name: Give Multi-Tool
Options.Text: We hand each other our Multi-Tools. With the exchange complete, the mirror-me fades away...

Options.Name: Shoot doppelganger
Options.Text:
I see my own look of fear in the doppelganger as I pull the trigger.

I blast myself in the chest.

IncomingMessages: I run my hands across the monolith's surface, my fingers reading its ancient runes. Suddenly, I am seized by some ancient power, its otherworldly vision replacing my own.
Korvax Echoes bless with language. Do not resist. You are safe, child.

A liquid metal lasso emerges and wraps itself around my helmet. It freezes in place, before pulling my head into contact with the glow of the monolith.

The ancient stone is warm, and deep inside I hear the hum of an arcane technology as it prepares to unleash itself. I look up back up to the glyphs to try to guess why this might be happening. They talk to me in an alien tongue.

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text:
An entire language floods every part of my mind.

I retain what I can. The rest fades almost instantaneously.

Options.Name: Pull free
Options.Text:
I wrench myself free. The strange metal connector sparks and hisses.

I retain the rare elements it was made from...

IncomingMessages: The monolith lets forth a silent scream. Words rage from the distant past, inserting themselves into my brain. My vision begins to swim.
Traveller! Move back to join future. Touch monolith to restore timeline.

My movements seem normal, but everything else is running faster than it should. The sun spins around this globe in seconds, days endlessly turn to night and back again. The creatures that graze and hunt around the site pass by in a blur.

I'm trapped in a time vortex. Numbers on my Multi-Tool seem to tick higher and higher. The closer I get to the Monolith, the more disturbance is added to the timeline...

Options.Name: Touch monolith
Options.Text: The timeline is reverted and restored. Nothing has changed.

Options.Name: Move away
Options.Text: I step out into the future. My experience is unchanged, but other passing entities have left piles of tribute at the foot of the monolith.

IncomingMessages:
For many ages it appears that pilgrims have carved numerical figures between the glowing glyphs of the monolith. Looking down, I notice an ancient coin. I scrape the ground with my boot, and unearth several more.

The site is otherwise silent. Perhaps it's eternally unresponsive, or perhaps it waits for something.

Options.Name: Offer units
Options.Text: The Echoes that dwell here awake. For the smallest slice of time, I feel a part of their ancient Convergence. They bless me.

Options.Name: Take coins
Options.Text: The Echoes that dwell here awake. I feel them swirl around my mind. It feels like... disappointment.

IncomingMessages: As I study the ancient runes, they begin to glow with an ethereal light. I can see wisps of a strange blue energy being pulled from the obelisk and swirling around my Multi-Tool.
Korvax Echoes bless technology. Allow entrance.
If I pull the trigger, the exhaust will automatically open - allowing this strange ethereal substance into the body of my equipment.

Options.Name: Pull the trigger
Options.Text: The blue energy field fills my Multi-Tool. It binds with the circuits and fabricates a new piece of technology.

Options.Name: Dismiss the monolith
Options.Text: The blue energy slowly dissipates.<DELAY>0.4<> I feel alone once more.

IncomingMessages:
I feel I am being watched. I turn, but can't see the potential assailant. But I know, with burning certainty, that they are there. Somewhere out there on the alien landscape, someone is about to launch an attack.
Suddenly, the words of an unknown power blaze brightly on the monolith.
Traveller, retreat! Korvax Echoes give protection. Move back.

Options.Name: Touch monolith
Options.Text:
The monolith does nothing. A distant crack, a bolt of thunder, the sharp stab of pain, the burn on my skin.

Beyond that, silence.

Options.Name: Stand still
Options.Text:
The monolith does nothing. A distant crack, a bolt of thunder, the sharp stab of pain, the burn on my skin.

Beyond that, silence.

Options.Name: Move back
Options.Text:
I quickly move back, allowing a bright red energy surge to build in the Monolith. A beam descends from the heavens and vaporises a distant object.
The monolith blesses me for my faith.

IncomingMessages: As I look upon the ancient relic, a strange feeling grips hold of me. My vision begins to swim. I am here, but not here.
Bathe in our waters. Feel Korvax Echoes calm. Bathe in our waters. Feel Korvax Echoes calm.

An expanding pool of liquid metal has rippled out of the obelisk's base. My feet have already been covered. In the bright reflection I see my expression turn to horror as I begin to sink.

I feel warming hands on my legs, pulling me down into the silver sheet. Every hazard detection device on my Multi-Tool is going haywire...

Options.Name: Sink
Options.Text: I emerge from the metal pool in a fetal position. I feel alive and reinvigorated.

Options.Name: Struggle
Options.Text: I thrash from side to side in the metal pool. I am free, but the hazards have taken their toll.

IncomingMessages: I touch my hands to the strange polished stone of the monolith. Images flood into my head, words and scenes screamed from another age.
Korvax Entities escaped slavery. Korvax Echoes share this knowledge. Be free.

Two stone blocks slowly revolve on the base of the monolith. Two beads of red light then trace images on each one. The red lights then pool together and liquefy in an indentation below. The closer I get, the more agitated the red pool becomes.

The images both show masked electronic lifeforms. The first shows the lifeform absorbing power to break free from its shackles. The second shows it hiding from its captors.

Options.Name: Place hand on the lifeform breaking free
Options.Text: The red liquid surges into my Multi-Tool. It materialises into a technology blueprint.

Options.Name: Place hand on the lifeform taking shelter
Options.Text: The red liquid surges into my Exosuit. It materialises into a technology blueprint.

IncomingMessages: A chiselled hole appears at the foot of the obelisk. From its smoothed edges and the scraped markings around it, it's clear that over centuries unknown creatures have pushed elements through this gap.
Korvax Echoes embrace Traveller gift.

It's impossible to tell quite what will happen, but below it are three blocks of the exact same dimensions that look like they can be turned by a mechanism deep within the monolith itself. I search my pack for elements that look like they could fit...

Options.Name: Insert organic element
Options.Text: The monolith somehow transforms my offering.

Options.Name: Insert rare metal
Options.Text: The monolith somehow transforms my offering.

Options.Name: Insert rare catalyst
Options.Text: The monolith somehow transforms my offering.

IncomingMessages: I'm inspecting the monolith's surface when I am seized by a strange vision. Its words echo in my skull.

The Monolith disappears. The landscape around me seems the same, but somehow the planetary vegetation has moved. Sitting central to where the mysterious stone once stood is a red glowing orb.

The intensity of the orb burns the ground beneath it. It crackles with an unknown power. I feel compelled to pick it up, and become a part of it. A distant voice speaks to me...
Behold the holy Atlas stone. Avoid contact. Show respect. Atlas! Atlas! Atlas!

Options.Name: Hold red orb
Options.Text: The red orb scorches my skin. I am torn painfully back to my own reality.

Options.Name: Stand back
Options.Text: The red orb convulses, hovers up and plunges into my chest. I am blessed and rejuvenated. Reality is restored.

IncomingMessages: An empty shell of an electronic lifeform emerges from the monolith. It is ancient and weather-beaten. The light in its mask has been extinguished for many centuries.
Korvax Echoes request! Traveller! Restore holy casing to Korvax Convergence! Ignore valuable casing! Please!
It holds a rusted canister in its hand, which my scanner detects once contained refined metal. The scan also reveals an unknown substance deep within the defunct entity's casing.

Options.Name: Add metal to canister
Options.Text:
The lights in the mask flicker on. The casing convulses before being absorbed back into the monolith.

I am blessed.

Options.Name: Open casing
Options.Text:
I crack open the metal casing and retrieve a valuable reward.

A strange feeling of coldness and desolation comes over me as I do so...

IncomingMessages: I rest upon the ancient relic. It screams in response, shouting in an ancient tongue, unaware of who or what I am. The words begin to distort my vision...

The inside of the planet is hollow, and I'm standing at the base of its vast bowl. Around me the roots of trees push upwards from uncovered alien soil.

I look down, and see the foundations of the Monolith raised at my feet. Crystalline veins of different elements pulsate through the exposed rock. I hear a lifeform screaming in binary.
Overpowered Korvax Echoes subvert reality. Restore order. Remove power. Remove organic corruption.

Options.Name: Extract organic elements
Options.Text: Reality is restored. Inversion ends. I am thanked.

Options.Name: Extract metal
Options.Text: The inversion gets worse. I feel as if every part of me is fed through itself. I emerge alive, but broken.

Options.Name: Extract rare metal
Options.Text: The inversion gets worse. I feel as if every part of me is fed through itself. I emerge alive, but broken.

IncomingMessages: The stone whispers as I approach, cool blue words that sparkle in the air, unmistakable and ancient. I am transported into a strange new reality.
Traveller. Embrace unknown. Shine light in darkness. Discover galaxy centre.

Stars have aligned above the monolith. In the heavens above two distinct lines of distant suns can be seen stretching out into the depths of space. To be here at this exact moment in time, when the moving parts of the galaxy are aligned so perfectly, would seem almost an impossibility.

I am filled with a strange calm. One line of stars points towards the glow of a dull red giant, the other an unseen point far, far beyond my vision.

Options.Name: Choose red giant
Options.Text:
The stars seem to move out of alignment. There is a slow, silent scream as the heavens begin to cry.

I am unrewarded, and alone.

Options.Name: Choose unseen point
Options.Text: I am blessed with a gift that will aid my journey to this distant, unknown location.

IncomingMessages:
I feel faint. Ill, even. Looking around, the vegetation that surrounds this ancient structure looks withered and sickly. The creatures of the planet, meanwhile, appear to keep their distance.
As I stare, a warning etches itself into the stone, the words of an ancient language...
Beware! Monolith create dangerous toxins! Poison! Move back!
Environmental warning sensors in my Exosuit are behaving erratically. The suit is fighting against a powerful force...

Options.Name: Touch the Monolith
Options.Text:
I place my hand upon the glowing heart of the monolith. My suit bonds with the stone, and my Hazard Protection system goes into override.
After a moment, I see the stone begin to shift. The toxic wave abates. My suit appears to have calmed the hostility in the core of the monolith.
I awake from the vision. I hear the whispering of grateful spirits. I am left a gift.

Options.Name: Boost Hazard Protection
Options.Text:
I overcharge my Hazard Protection systems, pushing back the hostile force that threatened to overwhelm it. I stand in the monolith's toxic presence, but nothing more seems to happen.
The great stone continues to poison the land. I close my eyes, and the vision ends.

IncomingMessages: The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.
Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.
Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.
The ancient marker hums at a frequency that burrows deep into my being, filling me with the voices of the Korvax Echoes.
Brilliant light erupts from the ancient marker. It encircles me, engulfing my mind with the memories and voices of the Korvax Echoes. The dreams of Entities who once worshipped here become my own.
Whispers spill from the sharp edges of the artifact, recounting the dreams and memories of the Korvax Echoes in my mother tongue.
I discover an excited message from off-world. It seems to be discussing a report with... an image of me at its centre!
Unknown lifeform research is HIGHLY commendable Entity! Discuss data with Korvax Convergence immediately!
Someone seems intrigued by my journey, and may well want to help. Should I get in touch?

Options.Name: Delete report
Options.Text:
The report is wiped from the system.

An off-world message appears briefly. It seems disappointed.

Options.Name: Open comms
Options.Text:
I briefly see mask lights staring out at me before the comms feed is cut.

The terminal rewards me with valuable knowledge.

IncomingMessages: I find a report filled with images of Sentinels, but its upload seems to have stalled.
Ahem. Planetary Sentinel scan data? UPLOAD SENTINEL SCAN DATA, ENTITY! IMMEDIATELY!
A demanding, perhaps rude, off-world message flashes at me. Somebody, somewhere, wants something.

Options.Name: Resend Sentinel data
Options.Text: The information packet is uploaded, and payment appears instantaneously.

Options.Name: Reply with a refusal
Options.Text: Bright red mask lights appear and scream in angry binary.

IncomingMessages: A mass-mailed off-world message shows damaged electronic lifeforms. Arms are ripped off, masks chewed and facial lights dimmed.
Korvax friend! Dangerous creatures attack Korvax Entity! For weaponry sales contact Gek Trade Federation today!
It feels offensive. It's clearly intended to shock recipients into a response. Replies can be sent with units attached...

Options.Name: Reply with units
Options.Text: I paid for a new Multi-Tool to protect me.

Options.Name: Reply with outrage
Options.Text: I receive no reply. But someone else appreciates me...

Options.Name: Do not reply
Options.Text: I leave the distasteful message unanswered.

IncomingMessages:
An image of a distant solar system is being studied here. A mineral-rich moon can be seen, orbiting a desolate and toxic-looking planet.
Slightly obscured in the background, meanwhile, is a strange dark-coloured smudge – a diamond shape floating in space. A hint of red flashes from its centre.
Atlas Interface awakes? Upload research findings immediately entity! Korvax Convergence sends relevant research technology!
There are no coordinates visible, but I can enhance different parts of the image to study them and automatically upload the terminal's findings.

Options.Name: Enhance moon image
Options.Text:
My research uploads.

I receive a Multi-Tool technology blueprint to aid my studies

Options.Name: Enhance planet image
Options.Text:
My research uploads.

I receive an exosuit technology blueprint to aid my studies.

Options.Name: Enhance diamond-shaped structure image
Options.Text:
My research uploads.

I receive a ship technology blueprint to aid my studies.

IncomingMessages: An off-world message to all planetary research stations has filled the screen with plans for a scientific expedition of some sort. Complex star charts, fuel requirements, complex communication rigs and plans for orbital experiments fill the screen.
Research entity! Atlas Interface mission begins! Donate contribution! Specialists apply here! Convergence sends specialists ship technology!
The outpost's resource vault is open to contributions of metals for the cause, while it also appears that the resident scientist could join the fleet... although it would require an upgraded ship.

Options.Name: Contribute a metal
Options.Text:
My contribution is accepted.

Useful knowledge is made available, with thanks.

Options.Name: Join team
Options.Text:
The scientist's application is accepted.

A ship technology blueprint is made available.

IncomingMessages: This outpost seems to be a vast library of production knowledge. A vast list of product formulas endlessly scrolls on the terminal, moving so fast that it hurts just to look at them. They appear to be catalogued by their base elements, but any deeper inspection makes me feel nauseous.
Korvax Convergence product catalogue available. Insert element to filter product catalogue.
The resource vaults next to me are open, and are clearly in regular use.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text: The terminal uses the element to isolate and select a reward.

Options.Name: Insert organic matter
Options.Text: The terminal uses the element to isolate and select a reward.

Options.Name: Insert metal
Options.Text: The terminal uses the element to isolate and select a reward.

IncomingMessages: Reams of data are flowing into this terminal from research outposts all over the planet. As well as a storage depot for the planetary products locked away in the vaults beneath my feet, this is a point of transmission.
Avoid data disruption! Korvax Convergence sends reward for additional data!

Knowledge accumulated on this world is being sent up to a scientific flagship hanging in orbit high above my head. I could easily breach the flow to improve my own knowledge, but sharing my own knowledge and discoveries is also an option.

Options.Name: Breach data flow
Options.Text:
I gain a new technology blueprint.

However, my breach corrupts the overall transfer...

Options.Name: Share knowledge
Options.Text:
The scientists study my offering...

... and thank me with a gift to aid me on my journey.

IncomingMessages: A back-up procedure has come to a standstill. The system is archiving a huge amount of language data, but the system has run out of memory to allocate.
Dialect data process stalled. Metal required to finish process.
I can attach my Multi-Tool to provide extra space, it would require some variety of metal to re-engage the process...

Options.Name: Insert common metal
Options.Text: The process restarts and provides me with knowledge of the language of the electronic lifeforms.

Options.Name: Insert uncommon metal
Options.Text: The process continues and improves my knowledge of the language of the electronic lifeforms.

Options.Name: Insert rare metal
Options.Text: The process completes and extends my knowledge of the language of the electronic lifeforms.

IncomingMessages: The facility is processing a signal that emanates from a distant location deep in space. Endless processing units are combining to crack the code of a strange mathematical language.
Atlas Interface signal awakes? Research entity! Insert catalyst constantly! Avoid disruption!
Rare elements are being pulled from the resource vaults at my feet, but some are running low.

Options.Name: Place metal in the vault
Options.Text:
The metals are added to the process.

They make no clear impact.

Options.Name: Place catalyst in the vault
Options.Text:
The material fuels the code cracking procedure.

A faint orb glows red on the screen, then slowly fades.

Options.Name: Take elements from vault
Options.Text:
I retrieve rare elements...

... but the code-breaking process grinds to a halt.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is abandoned, its alarms blaring a warning to souls long dead.

The Korvax in this installation quarantined themselves from the rest of their species, believing that a violent impulse was emerging within the group. Something happened to them out here... something awoke within their minds...
WARNING WARNING WARNING DIVERGENCE DIVERGENCE DIVERGENCE

Options.Name: Examine logs
Options.Text:
I examine the logs of the Korvax stationed here. They appear to have opened a gateway beneath the depths of the planet, an experimental device designed to see alternative versions of a planet in all their glory.
They broke through to a thousand other Korvax units just like themselves. They attempted to form a Second Convergence composed entirely of multiversal beings, of alternate versions of their own personalities.
The first deletions began a week later. Nothing is left but nanite clusters.

Options.Name: Purge facility
Options.Text: I purge the facility, discovering blueprints for experimental technology in the process. Whatever happened here should not be repeated.

Options.Name: Alert Korvax
Options.Text: I alert the Korvax to the disaster that occurred in this outpost, uploading its records to the Convergence. They reward me, claiming that the discoveries made in this location will open up worlds of study and science long since deemed impossible.

IncomingMessages:
The research station contains a vast array of scanners and monitoring equipment directed at bodies of water throughout the system. It is searching for signs of something designated 'abyss'.

The scientists who worked here seem to have been comparing the transmissions associated with the Atlas to strange signals found within the water.

Before they went missing, the workers concluded that this 'abyss' seemed to hold a similar yet distinct energy signature to the Atlas itself. Another power in the universe...
SCANNERS ONLINE... AWAITING TARGETING ARRAY...

Options.Name: Examine the abyss
Options.Text:
I examine the records relating to the abyss. They show a repeating pattern of sixteen energy bursts, music that emerges from beneath the waves.
Contact appears to alter individual personality and objectives, changing even the most devoted Korvax into an agent of some unfathomable power. 
Infected Nanite Clusters appear to be present within the archives. I take some of them. It seems to be for the best...

Options.Name: Examine the Atlas
Options.Text:
I examine the records relating to the Atlas. They show interfaces, reports of crimson light, and records of visitations and transcendent experiences from across the universe.
The Korvax theorise that the Atlas does not itself exist on this plane of reality, speaking to us only through surrogate representations.
Infected Nanite Clusters appear to be present within the archives. I take some of them. It seems to be for the best...

Options.Name: Alert Korvax
Options.Text:
I alert the Korvax to what happened here, but the Convergence claims to have had no knowledge of this facility or those working here. The Korvax involved disconnected from the Convergence two years ago, presumed dead...
I am rewarded for my data. The Korvax promise to investigate further.

IncomingMessages:
The facility seems to have been a meeting place for multiple Korvax factions, uploading and downloading from multiple bodies during tense diplomatic and war-time situations.

Even if one's whole species can unify at will with a single great mind, still, there is unique value in face-to-face communication. These Korvax recorded many things they wished to keep secret from their brethren. Some are always more equal than others.
RECORDS AVAILABLE... ACCESS UNENCRYPTED LOGS?

Options.Name: Access records
Options.Text:
I access the records of these meetings. The hidden society of the Korvax appear to have a plan, meeting throughout the years to manipulate and secretly meet with members of other species to influence the course of history.

I find nanites, but I also find something more. They met recently about the Travellers... about the Atlas... I saw my own face in their records.

I leave, wondering about what I have seen.

Options.Name: Report to Korvax Convergence
Options.Text: I report the facility's existence to the Korvax Convergence. Halfway through my communication, the console's connection cuts out, causing the facility's defense system to activates. I flee, my suit damaged.

Options.Name: Report to other species
Options.Text: I report the facility's existence to the Gek and the Vy'keen. Halfway through my communication, the console's connection cuts out, causing the facility's defense system to activates. I flee, my suit damaged.

IncomingMessages:
The outpost is ancient, even by the standards of the Korvax. The log speaks of alternate realities, histories of the Korvax that take radically divergent paths. 

In some regions of the multiverse, their progenitors never shed their biological origins. In others, they remain in the slavery of the Gek, never rising up or convincing their false masters of the glory of the Atlas.

Many of these realities have faded, gone as if they had never been.
UNIVERSAL ARCHIVE ON STANDBY... RESUME PROJECT?

Options.Name: Upload to the Korvax
Options.Text:
I upload the data to the Korvax. They absorb the memories of these alternate Korvax echoes to their own Convergence, carrying yet more sorrow. That is all there seems to be for them, whatever the galaxy...
They thank me, granting me Nanite Clusters through the terminal.

Options.Name: Search for yourself
Options.Text:
I search for some record of myself in these alternate realities, but see nothing but parallels in the lives of others. I stand alone.

I salvage Nanite Clusters from the terminal and leave, disturbed by my absence.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I search for technology within the facility's computers. I find none, though there are unencrypted units.

IncomingMessages:
The facility allowed for the quarantine and processing of Korvax minds to and from their central Convergence.

The log shows records of troubled Korvax minds, those disturbed by their actions; those haunted by sorrow; those who might threaten the minds they encountered. They arrive here, away from the Convergence, seeking to overcome pain or purge themselves.

A single Korvax soul remains. According to the log, it has inhabited this system for thirty years.
... /// ... /// ... BOUNDARIES AT FULL POWER ... /// ... /// ...

Options.Name: Upload to Convergence
Options.Text:
I upload the soul to the Convergence.
It cries out as it goes, condemning me for my action. I am left with nothing.

Options.Name: Wipe system
Options.Text: I wipe the system. The Korvax disappears and I am left with Nanite Clusters, the unformed matter of the system.

Options.Name: Comfort the Korvax
Options.Text:
I attempt to comfort the Korvax, sharing with them the story of my travels.

They thank me for the attempt, but they claim it is not enough. The one they loved is dead. There is nothing left for them but this solace, this penance for what they have done.

They give me a token of gratitude and ask me to leave them alone. They wish to remain in solitude.

IncomingMessages:
The facility acted as a central upload point for Korvax scans from a thousand worlds, collating their data in an attempt to understand the underlying mechanics of the universe.

The problem was existence. The solution was a single number, a warning screamed by every atom in the firmament. 'Sixteen'...

Sixteen...

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I steal data from the system, leaving the rest of the facility in peace.

Options.Name: Analyse data
Options.Text:
I analyse the data, attempting to understand the meaning of this conclusion.

Something notices me. Something reads me as I read it. I leave, terrified, my exosuit's systems damaged by the encounter.

Options.Name: Contribute scans
Options.Text:
I contribute scans from my own systems, trying to enhance the Korvax model. 

The Convergence notices and rewards me greatly for my assistance.

IncomingMessages:
An incoming message contains the report of a Korvax spy.

The individual was disguised within a Gek body, acting for many years as if they were a simple ToilGek. They harvested much data from those they called friends. This was the purpose of the experiment: the enemy must be understood.

The enemy must never be forgiven, even until the end of time itself. Even in the face of damnation. The Korvax will never forget the violence committed against them. They will never release their anger...
... INCOMING MESSAGE... HIGH PRIORITY SIGNAL...

Options.Name: Upload report to Gek
Options.Text:
I upload the report to the Gek and am rewarded with credits for uncovering the spy in their midst.

They tell me that after a period of data extraction, the Korvax unit will be disposed of and stored for further study. My involvement ends here.

Options.Name: Upload report to Korvax
Options.Text: I upload the report to the Korvax. The entities are suspicious of my aid, paying me with Nanite Clusters to ensure my silence. Their struggle will go on.

IncomingMessages: The air is compromised. My entry has allowed the fearsome external chill to overwhelm sensitive systems. Even the primary terminal is failing beneath my finger-tips.
Alert! Alert! Power core isolated! Central artificial intelligence core endangered! Hostile environment detected!
A number of recovery operations are available...

Options.Name: Seal off power core
Options.Text: I safeguard the power core against the breach. However, vital control systems appear to have been damaged beyond repair.<DELAY>0.4<> I listen to the hum of the powerplant, the only sound audible in the now inoperable facility.

Options.Name: Seal off primary motherboard
Options.Text: I seal off the facility's primary motherboard. However, vital control systems appear to have been damaged beyond repair.<DELAY>0.4<> The entirely facility starts to shut down.

Options.Name: Seal off central AI
Options.Text: I safeguard the control units that house the facility's primary AI.<DELAY>0.4<> With the computer running the facility, the appropriate countermeasures are soon deployed and the hostile environment purged.

IncomingMessages: Systems are super-charged despite the security alert. Equipment beneath my feet buzzes and whirrs with a high intensity. The terminal blinks a warning.
Danger! Excess power! Decrease energy use immediately! Delivery at maximum!
I detect a faint smell of burning...

Options.Name: Reduce power delivery levels
Options.Text: I reduce power delivery across the board. The installation returns to acceptable activity levels.

Options.Name: Increase fan power delivery
Options.Text: I turn up the cooling systems.<DELAY>0.5<> The added strain on power delivery leads to a small internal fire. The terminal shuts down.

Options.Name: Increase coolant power delivery
Options.Text: I turn up the cooling systems.<DELAY>0.5<> The added strain on power delivery leads to a small internal fire. The terminal shuts down.

IncomingMessages: My unauthorised intrusion has activated an alert on the control terminal. Its lights flash an angry, hostile red.
Reboot initialised. Data loss probability warning. Offsite back-up detonation initialised.
Security countermeasures have begun a full system wipe. I see file after file being purged from the records.

Options.Name: Force restart
Options.Text: I forcibly restart the system.<DELAY>0.8<>. After a short delay, the screen comes back to life. All trace of the security programme has vanished.

Options.Name: Save data
Options.Text: My attempt to meddle is detected immediately. The system reboots to a blank screen. All data has been lost.

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text: As I wait, the countermeasures complete their purge of the system. The terminal shuts down, its screen a lifeless black.

IncomingMessages: The primary terminal is non-responsive, but comms seem open.
Warning. Calm, entity! Contact Convergence technology entity for help
I can open up conversation with whoever - or whatever - installed it.

Options.Name: Request remote help
Options.Text:
The bright lights of an electronic lifeform appear on a nearby screen. It chitters brightly.

I receive a reward for my report.

Options.Name: Hard reset the system
Options.Text: The facility becomes entirely unresponsive.

IncomingMessages: My entry into the facility has interrupted an automated maintenance routine. The terminal flashes a warning message:
Save failed! Tech blueprint data corrupted! Reconstruction probability: high
A fragmented file appears to have frozen the system. The machine is stuck in a loop trying to access it.

Options.Name: Attempt reconstruction
Options.Text: The data recovery operation completes successfully. One by one the errors clear from the terminal screen.

Options.Name: Delete file
Options.Text: Manually deleting the corrupted file appears to free the machine from its degenerate loop. I can only hope it contained nothing valuable.

IncomingMessages: The facility rings with the blare of an alarm. However, it appears I am not the first intruder. The terminal display indicates a previous hijack attempt.
Virus detection warning! File extracting valuable data!
Strange, shifting glyphs dance across the terminals command prompt. Some alien code is taking over the system's research drive.

Options.Name: Quarantine alien process
Options.Text: The quarantine operation is succesful and the alien code is purged from the system. The alarms fall silent.

Options.Name: Permit alien process
Options.Text:
I tap out a few commands, acknowleding but not removing the virus.
There is a short, almost deliberate delay. Runes shift across the display.<DELAY>0.6<> The terminal grants me root access to the facility. The alien code resumes its harvesting operation.

IncomingMessages: The outpost appears to have been in the middle of complex planetary scan. Alarms sound against my intrusion, but the operation continues. I attempt to make sense of the output.
Warning! Interruption forbidden! Sentinel scan ending soon! Control returning to overseer imminently!
The scan continues. It seems to be consuming all the facility's resources, preventing other operations. A large red override button blinks temptingly.

Options.Name: Cancel planetary scan
Options.Text: I hit the override button. The scan data is deleted.<DELAY>0.8<> A remote process, detecting the premature end of the scan, shuts down the entire facility.

Options.Name: Wait
Options.Text: I wait, patient. The scan finishes processing and uploads its data. With this special task complete, the facility comes back online.

IncomingMessages: Two electronic lifeforms are registered on this terminal.
Korvax research log. Primary entity: product recipe research. Secondary entity: technological blueprint reconstruction.
The primary entity's work is full of complicated chemical symbols, the secondary entity focuses on diagrams of electronic circuitry.

Options.Name: Login as Primary Entity
Options.Text: The primary entity's workflow procedure provides some useful knowledge.

Options.Name: Login as Secondary Entity
Options.Text: The secondary entity's workflow procedure provides a technology blueprint.

IncomingMessages: My entry has caused the facility to go into immediate lockdown, interrupting its operation. Readouts on the terminal indicate some sort of deep-level exploratory or drilling operation.
Geological scan in progress! Medial strata mined. Remote connection error! Immediate probe recall required!
A probe schematic flashes red. Some input appears to be required.

Options.Name: Recall probe
Options.Text:
I hear the whirr of gears and the hissing of metal cable. The facility shudders slightly as the machinery bites into the cable and begins to pull.
After an agonising delay, the terminal reports a successful extraction. The alarms cease.

Options.Name: Restart probe
Options.Text: I try several times to restart the probe. It fails to respond to my commands. Meanwhile, the malfunction alerts grow ever harsher.

Options.Name: Detonate probe
Options.Text: I hear a deep, distant noise, a subterranean roll of thunder. Alerts and alarms fill the terminal screen, most of them flashing angrily. The terminal refuses to accept further input.

IncomingMessages:
Alarms blare, sounding out against my intrusion. The facility is remotely operated, and no-one responds to the klaxon's call.
The terminal indicates the facility was undertaking a specialised piece of research.
Experiment containment failure. Common fuel element overcharge explosion. Clarify should continue?
The terminal appears to be asking for manual confirmation of its experiment...

Options.Name: Continue experiment
Options.Text:
I tap a few commands into the terminal, authorising it to continue.
There is a pause, then a rumble.<DELAY>0.6<> Fire belches from the hopper. Smoke seeps from the terminal keyboard. The entire system shuts down.

Options.Name: End experiment
Options.Text:
I tap a few commands into the terminal, bringing it to an end. A small amount of ash is ejected from a nearby hopper.
The machinery hums as it reconfigures itself for standard research operations.

Options.Name: Insert carbon
Options.Text:
I tap a few commands into the terminal, opening its input hopper. I insert some carbon from Exosuit.
There is a pause, then a rumble.<DELAY>0.6<> Fire belches from the hopper. Smoke seeps from the terminal keyboard. The entire system shuts down.

IncomingMessages: Security systems have reacted to my unauthorised entry. The terminal barks a series of warnings.
Illegal access! Security control deployed! All goods will be incinerated!
The terminal cycles images of flames. I can feel the heat rising from the resource vaults below.

Options.Name: Submit cancellation request
Options.Text: The flames in the resource vault subside. The facility has lost some of its supplies, but is otherwise undamaged.

Options.Name: Activate fire extinguishers
Options.Text: The flames in the resource vault subside. The facility has lost some of its supplies, but is otherwise undamaged.

Options.Name: Add fuel
Options.Text: I add oxygen to the fire raging in the vaults below. The intensity increases and smoke floods from the resource hoppers. The terminal shuts down, and my suit begins to overheat. I have only myself to blame.

IncomingMessages: A wired metal dart springs from a panel and slams through my visor. It pierces the skin on my forehead, and I feel a faint electrical current.
Eheu Entity! Vital words accidentally corrupted? Pay units to relearn!
Whether ransom, paid service or security device - the terminal seems to want payment...

Options.Name: Insert units
Options.Text: I learn more of the binary language of the electronic lifeforms.

Options.Name: Insert units
Options.Text: I learn a little of the binary language of the electronic lifeforms.

Options.Name: Remove dart
Options.Text:
I remove the dart.

The terminal's processes conclude.

IncomingMessages: Machinery here is mining a captured asteroid for oxides. The process has stalled. The facility reeks of burnt metal, and the floor is hot to touch. I search the terminal for clues.
Eheu, drill motor automated disconnection! Motor fire! Repair immediately Entity!
The terminal presents a number of repair drone options. <DELAY>0.2<> Beneath my feet I hear the ominous creaking and popping of metal straining against itself.

Options.Name: Repair drill bit
Options.Text:
The asteroid mining drill bit is replaced.

It remains non-operational.

Options.Name: Repair drill motor
Options.Text:
The facility deploys a swarm of nano-drones deep within its inner workings. The terminal tracks their progress towards the repair site.
Countless drones perish in the fire, but they eventually get on top of heat levels in the malfunctioning drill motor.<DELAY>0.4<>. Slowly but surely, the facility comes back online.

IncomingMessages: I rapidly flick through alien warnings to discover what's brought the facility offline.
Warning! Temporal capacitor disengaged! Production time loop detected!
All too late, I realise I'm doing the exact same thing again. And again. I've done this before. Many times.

Options.Name: Recharge flux crystals
Options.Text:
I loop in time for several days.

An automated process eventually rescues me.

Options.Name: Engage temporal capacitor
Options.Text:
The temporal capacitor ends the time loop.

The facility resumes operations.

Options.Name: Reset clock
Options.Text:
I loop in time for several days.

An automated process eventually rescues me.

IncomingMessages: My intrusion has triggered some sort of scrambled shutdown. Even over the sound of the alarm, I can hear the rumble of elements cascading away through the pipes. The terminal blinks a warning:
Warning! Catalyst overload! Circuit board technology overheat warning!
It seems that the system is struggling to cope with the overflow. An automated emergency stop is about to be issued.

Options.Name: Detach supply chute
Options.Text: The noise of cascading elements subsides. The alarms cease.<DELAY>0.4<> However, so does the facility's operation.

Options.Name: Override security alert
Options.Text: Overriding the security alert immediately stops the alarm. With no reason to prolong the shutdown process, the facility's AI reverses the element cascade and returns system to normal.

Options.Name: Inject coolant
Options.Text: I activate the facility's coolant injectors. The cascade continues, but the warnings become less severe. Eventually, they stop. The problem has been brought under control, though the facility is substantially less wealthy.

IncomingMessages: The air is compromised. My entry has allowed the overwhelming atmospheric heat to overwhelm sensitive systems. Even the primary terminal is failing beneath my finger-tips.
Alert! Alert! Power core isolated! Central artificial intelligence core endangered! Hostile environment detected!
A number of recovery operations are available...

Options.Name: Seal off power core
Options.Text: I safeguard the power core against the breach. However, vital control systems appear to have been damaged beyond repair.<DELAY>0.4<> I listen to the hum of the powerplant, the only sound audible in the now inoperable facility.

Options.Name: Seal off primary motherboard
Options.Text: I seal off the facility's primary motherboard. However, vital control systems appear to have been damaged beyond repair.<DELAY>0.4<> The entirely facility starts to shut down.

Options.Name: Seal off central AI
Options.Text: I safeguard the control units that house the facility's primary AI.<DELAY>0.4<> With the computer running the facility, the appropriate countermeasures are soon deployed and the hostile environment purged.

IncomingMessages: The installation has been hacked. A coded transmission has breached security and is stealing data.
Warning! Vy'keen vessel transmission detected. Data upload to starship.
Two wavelengths are open. One from this planet's surface, and the other from high above.

Options.Name: Block planetary signal
Options.Text:
The coded transmission takes full control.

The terminal powers down.

Options.Name: Block orbital signal
Options.Text:
The coded transmission is blocked.

The facility returns to an operational status.

Options.Name: Report intrusion
Options.Text:
The transmission is blocked.

I receive a note of thanks from the facility overseer.

IncomingMessages: Operations are offline. A recent research scan has been corrupted, likely by my unexpected interruption. It is crashing every system in the outpost.
Bad data. Sentinel drone activity scan corrupted. System disengaged.
The terminal scrolls through a list of potentially corrupt files. I appear to have deletion rights...

Options.Name: Delete planetary quadruped scan
Options.Text: I delete a number of files related to the quadrupeds that guard the facility, but the system remains offline

Options.Name: Delete Sentinel scan
Options.Text: I delete an unusually large file, a scan the network process that controls the nearby Sentinel drones.<DELAY>0.5<> There is a sudden, large jump in available computational resources. The installation's primary processes begin to restart.

Options.Name: Delete geological survey
Options.Text: I delete a number of geological data packets, but the system remains offline

IncomingMessages: Wild energy fluctuations have brought research operations to a standstill. When I touch the terminal to investigate, a residual electric charge earths itself through my Exosuit.
Alert! Electronic terminal operator power discharge! Reset primary interface!
Readouts on the terminal indicate the power fluctuations are getting stronger and wilder. It will not be long before they bring down the entire facility.

Options.Name: Stabilise production battery
Options.Text: I attempt to stabilise the flow of power throughout the facility, but the fluctuations continue. The terminal begins to short out, then dramatically shuts down completely.

Options.Name: Reset primary terminal
Options.Text: I reset the primary interface. One by one, systems come back online. The power fluctuations cease.

IncomingMessages: Systems are super-charged despite the security alert. Equipment beneath my feet buzzes and whirrs with a high intensity. The terminal blinks a warning.
