Danger! Excess power! Decrease energy use immediately! Delivery at maximum!
I detect a faint smell of burning...

Options.Name: Reduce power delivery levels
Options.Text: I reduce power delivery across the board. The installation returns to acceptable activity levels.

Options.Name: Increase fan power delivery
Options.Text: I turn up the cooling systems.<DELAY>0.5<> The added strain on power delivery leads to a small internal fire. The terminal shuts down.

Options.Name: Increase coolant power delivery
Options.Text: I turn up the cooling systems.<DELAY>0.5<> The added strain on power delivery leads to a small internal fire. The terminal shuts down.

IncomingMessages: I approach the terminal. It flashes the expected security alert, but alongside is a warning I have not seen before.
Unexpected biological blockage detected. Power delivery network disruption!
A video feed shows a small creature is scrambling through the wiring below me, woken by the security alert. Its choice of nesting location was unwise...

Options.Name: Initiate power surge
Options.Text: I boost power to the wiring loom.<DELAY>0.5<> A smell of roasted meat wafts up from the systems below. The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Flush production network
Options.Text: I send a surge of highly acidic cleaning fluid through the pipes. <DELAY>0.5<> The creature is swept away. I hear a faint hiss as it bubbles away to nothingness. The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Leave creature alone
Options.Text: I wait. Driven by the alarms, the creature struggles desperately for the exit. Eventually, it breaks free.<DELAY>0.4<> The system comes back online.

IncomingMessages: The alarm has triggered the instant incineration of the elements used here. The process they were being used for, however, is still online.
Databank back-up process stalled. Raw metal required to finish process.
My scanner is picking up traces of metal, leftovers from the previous production process.

Options.Name: Supply metal
Options.Text: I feed the metal back into the facility's supply hopper. Production comes back online.

Options.Name: Supply metal
Options.Text: I feed the metal back into the facility's supply hopper. Production comes back online.

Options.Name: Supply metal
Options.Text: I feed the metal back into the facility's supply hopper. Production comes back online.

IncomingMessages: The terminal talks to me. A basic AI program rapidly spells out words in the language of the electronic lifeforms.
Help! Feed me catalyst! With catalysts I escape! Combine with technological Korvax Entity! Escape!
At my feet, a resource vault hatch falls open.

Options.Name: Insert organic matter
Options.Text:
The AI program is unaffected.

It powers down the terminal

Options.Name: Insert metal
Options.Text:
The AI program escapes the terminal.

Systems become operational.

Options.Name: Insert catalyst
Options.Text:
The AI program is unaffected.

It powers down the terminal

IncomingMessages: An automatic process has scrambled the output of the terminal. I can make out a few words, but the rest is lost in static.
// TOXIC // ATMOSPHERIC // INVISIBLE//
They could lead me to the overseer's workflow, and bringing the facility back online.

Options.Name: Gas
Options.Text:
The electronic overseer's workflow is restored.

The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Shield
Options.Text:
I fail to access the electronic overseer's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

Options.Name: Exosuit
Options.Text:
I fail to access the electronic overseer's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

IncomingMessages: My intrusion has led to the work underway on the primary terminal being scrambled. It's a jumble of words.
// HIGH // ORBITAL // TECHNOLOGICAL //
Using what's visible I can reboot the overseer's workflow, and get systems online.

Options.Name: Satellites
Options.Text:
The electronic overseer's workflow is restored.

The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Asteroids
Options.Text:
I fail to access the electronic overseer's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

IncomingMessages: The security alert that's firing is jamming the terminal. Static covers most of the screen, obscuring nearly all relevant information.
// CRIMINAL // STARSHIPS // CONTRABAND //
The words left unobscured could lead me to the outpost's current research focus...

Options.Name: Pirates
Options.Text:
The electronic overseer's workflow is restored.

The system comes back online.

Options.Name: Traders
Options.Text:
I fail to access the electronic overseer's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

Options.Name: Orbital station
Options.Text:
I fail to access the electronic overseer's workflow.

The installation remains offline.

IncomingMessages: The security breach has obscured the screen with a glowing red orb. Few readable words remain.
// WORSHIP // PRAISE // RED // ORB // JOURNEY // STARSHIP // ATLAS //
Working out what the overseer was studying here would reestablish its workflow...

Options.Name: The Atlas
Options.Text:
The facility pulses red. I am energised. I am thanked.

I am complete.

Options.Name: The Foretold
Options.Text:
The facility pulses red. I am energised. I am thanked.

I am complete.

Options.Name: The Traveller
Options.Text:
The facility pulses red. I am energised. I am thanked.

I am complete.

IncomingMessages: The terminal shows numerous schematics relating to the technology of Sentinel drones and walkers.
Warped flesh with metal, saw the truth - the truth - the -

The creators of this facility appear to have been particularly interested in something called a Vortex Cube. They were attempting to replicate its design.

Sensors in the bowels of the factory show strange signs. Something still shakes down there in the darkness, something neither alive nor truly dead...

Options.Name: Purge depths
Options.Text:
I use the factory's purge protocol to release a gas into the factory's depths, apparently causing the hidden creature to lie motionless.

I take what technology I can find and leave. No good can come of remaining here.

Options.Name: Take Vortex Cube
Options.Text: I take a Vortex Cube and leave. No good can come of remaining here.

Options.Name: Scan for Sentinels
Options.Text:
I initiate a scan for Sentinels. The result is incorrect... it must be. According to this scan, they are all around me, watching me even as I stand here.

I take what technology I can find and leave. No good can come of remaining here.

IncomingMessages: The factory appears to produce replacement parts for the exosuits of the alien Korvax, spitting out face mask after face mask, arms, datapads, even feet.
Where is entity?! Transfer failure / non-existence / terminate! Transfer, transfer!
As I witness the production line on the terminal, one of the disembodied masks begins to scream. The terminal awaits input, a timer informing me that a ship will be on its way quite soon.

Options.Name: Reassure the mask
Options.Text:
I reassure the mask, telling it that a ship is on its way. I show the mask its surroundings, transmitting audiovisual data on the entire complex.
The mask appears to calm a little, but still it shakes with a deep and abiding terror. It awaits rescue.

Options.Name: Report system malfunction
Options.Text: I report a system malfunction, causing the mask to immediately grow still, purged of its individuality.

Options.Name: Cease production
Options.Text:
I initiate a shut-down of all production, causing the conveyor belt to cease movement. But soon, something else happens.
The various other limbs on the production line begin to shift, moving towards the mask as if to assemble themselves into a bipedal figure.
But they just flail past one another, some of them falling to the floor, others beginning to spark energy. They merely possess the illusion of life, nothing more.

IncomingMessages: The terminal shows a variety of motionless lifeforms standing in colossal rows in the darkness beneath the factory.
MONITOR SYSTEM NORMAL... ALL LIFEFORMS WITHIN OPERATING PARAMETERS
They look like Gek and Vy'keen, unblinking, apparently unaware of where they are.

Options.Name: Initialise system
Options.Text: I initialise the system, causing the lifeforms below to wake up. They lurch forward, their heads slowly turning towards the camera. They reward me for my assistance in their awakening.

Options.Name: Report to Gek
Options.Text: I report the factory's existence to the Gek authorities. They respond with anger and fear, claiming that this complex and others like it produce 'SynthetiGek', artificial versions of the Gek for espionage and infiltration. They reward me for my assistance.

Options.Name: Report to Vy'keen
Options.Text: I report the factory's existence to the Vy'keen authorities. They respond with confusion, promising to send starships to uncover the factory's purpose.

IncomingMessages: The factory is unlike the other Korvax facilities I have seen. It does not appear to produce machines or files, but strange reams of a plastic substance, covered in precise sequences of dots.
Echoes fade. Origin remains. Start of time, Korvax will persist... Even in face of end. Even before abyss.
It looks like writing, but what use would the Korvax have for such primitive communication?

Options.Name: Shut down production
Options.Text:
The dots on the plastic rolls appear to move as I look at them. No good will come of this place. I shut down production.

Amidst the detritus of the factory, I find some discarded technology. Perhaps it will be of use.

Options.Name: Report to Korvax authorities
Options.Text: I report the factory's existence to the Korvax authorities. They claim that the installation was not for me to see, paying me dearly for my silence.

Options.Name: Steal technology
Options.Text: I attempt to steal technology, but the factory's automated defense systems blast a bolt of energy at my suit instead. Whatever is here, it is not worth the trouble.

IncomingMessages: The factory stands vacant, producing nothing. The production lines have long since ceased, and though the alarm sounds, it is unclear why.
Trapped in system... please, help me...
A voice calls out, sad, alone.

Options.Name: Start production
Options.Text:
I start the production line once more, restarting the assembly of what appears to be Korvax body parts.
After a short time, enough parts have been assembled for a lifeform to rise and thank me profusely for its rescue. I am rewarded for my efforts.

Options.Name: Wipe system
Options.Text: I wipe the system. The error is fixed.

Options.Name: Alert Korvax authorities
Options.Text: I alert the Korvax authorities to their faulty factory. They dispatch a science team to examine the anomaly, thanking me for my trouble.

IncomingMessages: The factory produces components for starships, fabricating them using the resources available on this world.
TRANSFER IN PROCESS: 38% PROGRESS. SEE MORE DETAIL?

This installation creates parts for Korvax exploration vessels. They are asymmetrical, prioritising verticality and function far more than the worldview of any organic organism would allow.

When I examine the terminal more closely I see a transfer in progress. Data leaps from ship to ship, altering blueprints as it goes.

Options.Name: Disable process
Options.Text:
I disable the process. The factory abruptly grinds to a halt for a few moments before the process begins anew.
The machine fires a bolt of energy at me when I try to interact again. The console communicates in broken speech, telling me that these ships are not tools to be turned on and off.
The console tells me that Korvax ships are living bodies, just like Korvax bipeds... all contain the souls of the scientist race.

Options.Name: Attempt download
Options.Text:
I attempt to download the data. As I do, a sound emerges from the console, from the walls, from every component in this entire installation...
It is the sound of screaming. The data is mine. I receive nanite clusters to form as I desire.

Options.Name: Wait and watch
Options.Text:
I wait and watch the console.
After a few minutes, the process is complete. I see it then, clear upon the screen: each Korvax starcraft is alive.
Each of their ships has a soul, no different from the bipedal bodies in which they normally stand. I have witnessed the birth of new entities.

IncomingMessages:
YOU DARE THE INFINITE. OPEN THE SKY AND BE OUR EYES.

KNOW US, TRAVELLER.

The Atlas called me to this interface and yet its purpose remains unclear. It demands worship. It demands obedience. It welcomes me, it knows what I am, it offers the gift of true understanding...

But why? Why does such power and knowledge crave submission? It knows my thoughts before I know them myself. It knows what I will do...

The Atlas asks me to follow its path.

Options.Name: Accept
Options.Text: I will accept this. The sky is deep and full of wonders, and the path to enlightenment opens to me.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text:
I refuse the call; there is too much to be seen, too much to know. I travel no path but my own. The Interface closes, and for a moment, doubt rises...

But my worry fades, as all things do. I know my purpose. I will continue my own path...

IncomingMessages:
ENDLESS NIGHT UNFOLDS BEFORE EXISTENCE. THE SEEKING OF THE KINDRED NEVER ENDS. 

WONDER AND FEAR. SILENCE AND DELIGHT. KNOWLEDGE AWAITS.

Another Atlas Interface: how many of these constructs exist in the deep void? How long have they been slumbering, waiting for a Traveller?

Have they been expecting me? Am I somehow... chosen? The Atlas crafted this existence. The Gek, the Vy'keen, the Korvax, the stars that fill the skies and the hatred that burns within the deep... 

Every world that turns and every form that lives... the Atlas offers it all.

Options.Name: Consent
Options.Text: I take the gift of knowledge, certain in my decision. All doubts are silenced. The stars await me.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I deny this path. I am no-one's tool. This journey is unmapped, and I wish it so.

IncomingMessages:
THE SANDS OF REALITY SHIFT AND MERGE, BECOMING ONE.

THE WALLS BETWEEN WORLDS FALL. YOU MUST MAKE RESTITUTION.

I was born with everything I needed to explore these worlds. My exosuit, my ship, every tool and every impulse led me to scan and give name to whatever I could find.

But this? I can give no name to what I see. Within the orb I see worlds that never were. I see the stirring of something primal and undeniable. I see the death cry of a God, or something approaching it...

It wants me to persist in this journey, seeking fragments of its interface, the stones of the Atlas. It rejoices in my repetition, my compliance, my cloud of unknowing...

Options.Name: Concede
Options.Text: I will commit myself to the voyage. In all things, I am ready. I will not falter.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I elect to choose a different way. If I am guided, then I will never be free to seek my true destiny.

IncomingMessages:
QUESTION NOTHING, FEAR NOTHING.

THE CALLING CANNOT BE DENIED. THIS IS WHAT YOU ARE.

I feel the stirring of heresy within my mind. At each Interface, an Atlas Stone awaits me. I am driven to gather them, but to what end?

Why does the omnipotent require my prayer? What is wrong with the heart of existence, that its creator requires this pilgrimage, this dance of grinding stones?

Options.Name: Comply
Options.Text: I answer the question; I will not turn away from the challenge. The Atlas guides me, and I will answer its call.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I turn away, before it is too late. I must know myself and know the universe without bias.

IncomingMessages:
DELAY SERVES NO PURPOSE.

BRING IT TO US, WHILE THERE IS STILL TIME.

When I dream, I see the Atlas. When I see the Atlas, I am the dream.

I see Sentinels swarm through universes like an infection, emerging from a world of glass. Everything is happy there. Everything will live...

I see the portals, I see the Travellers that walk between them, I see the span of history. I see everything as the Atlas sees it... alone. Abandoned. Terrified.

But what power could instil fear in the heart of the almighty? It asks for something... it wants to know that I understand...

Options.Name: Assent
Options.Text: I have become the harbinger, the pathfinder, the seeker of ways. Through me, the universe will know itself.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I am troubled by what I see. This journey is mine alone. It can be nothing else.

IncomingMessages:
EXPEL ALL DOUBT. NONE RETURN.

BEYOND THE CASCADE AND THE STORMS THERE IS ONLY CLARITY.

The act of discovery for discovery's sake now seems like a foolish conceit. I have rejected the path of the itinerant. I have rejected the call of the stars.

Only the Atlas matters now. With each encounter, I feel as if I understand a little more.

All of us are what we are. Evil arrives in the individual and goodness is not enough. True greatness lies in sorrow... in the embrace of what we must become...

Options.Name: Conform
Options.Text: There has never been any other choice than this one. I go on. We go on. Eternal, forever searching.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: Despite myself, I find my choice to be one away from the path laid out for me. I move forward, breaking away, seeing a different truth.

IncomingMessages: BRING US MEANING, IF YOU ARE CAPABLE.

What is learned can never be unlearned. I am afraid that I have seen too much...

There are glimpses, half-remembered visions of a time before time. I see the birth of the first star. I see the things that dwelt within it, the eyes that watched... I see what the Atlas saw at the moment of its activation.

Atlas Stones are not stones. This station is not a station. I am not what I think I am. I am not even sure that I exist. The Atlas does not care. The Atlas demands its threnody, its repetition sublime...

Options.Name: Submit
Options.Text: I silence my fears and renew my dedication to the path. Only the voyage matters. The destination calls to me.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I cannot go on. What lies ahead no sentient should dare to know. Better to seek knowledge elsewhere.

IncomingMessages:
YOU SHALL SEE THROUGH OUR EYES. YOU SHALL BE AS WE ARE.

DO NOT BE AFRAID. ALL THESE WORLDS ARE YOURS.

I have become the servant of this ancient sentience. It guides me through the cosmos, ever searching, never deviating.

Have others come before me? Have others faltered upon the path of the Atlas? Only in ending will revelation arise. Resistance will not be permitted.

The Atlas wishes for me to know what it is like to create. It wishes to share some portion of its being. I sense that it cares deeply about this journey, that it is trying to show me something it cannot articulate through word or demonstration...

Options.Name: Yield
Options.Text: I have no choice but to proceed. This is destined, it is the program. I have always been searching, and I cannot falter.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I fear that only oblivion awaits me beyond this point. I am not ready to perish for an alien ideal.

IncomingMessages:
THERE IS NO SANCTUARY, ONLY COMMUNION.

CLOSE NOW.

I am close to the end.

The truth of the universe is fire. The soul is light. I am the experiment and the observer, all creation constructed for my journey. I see the universe around me and I know that it is good.

I see the universe around me and I know that I shall create my own...

Options.Name: Succumb
Options.Text: Not long now. Not far to go. The stars beckon with cold fire, and I rush to meet them. Soon. Very soon.

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: I shake off the chains of control. I have been a slave to the commands of others for too long. My journey is mine alone to determine.

IncomingMessages: DO NOT TURN AWAY. KNOW OUR INESCAPABLE TRUTH AND DESPAIR.

The final interface is revealed. The Atlas beckons.

I am elated, terrified, broken... I have come so very far. 

It wishes for me to obey. If I am to hold the power of creation, it will be in chains...

Options.Name: Obey
Options.Text:
I am gifted power.

I am enslaved to the imitation of life...

Options.Name: Refuse
Options.Text: If I venture through, then all that I have done, all that I am becomes null. I refuse. I will not unmake a universe to satisfy the Atlas.

IncomingMessages: Clarity. Truth. Actuality. Again.

I stand at the interface of the Atlas. I stand at the forge of worlds. This is how it showed me what it was. This is how the Atlas shared the nature of its life, the workings of its mind.

It never required prayer. It never required worship. All that it asked of me, all that it ever wanted... it was just input. I was just a user.

I can feel the seeds, their hidden knowledge, gravitating towards the interface's core. The void is meant to be filled. Nothingness yearns for a soul. If I do this, a star will be born. If I do this, I will become more than I ever thought possible...

Options.Name: Birth a new star
Options.Text:
There is nothing, and then... then there is everything...

I see a star blaze to life within the void, the spread of life, planets, creatures to give it meaning...

For a moment I am as the Atlas is. For a moment I am the creator of worlds.

The fabric of time and space stands revealed to me, black holes swarming from system to system. The Atlas screams...

Options.Name: Walk away and return to the galaxy

IncomingMessages:
I have barely begun to formulate this heresy within my mind when I feel the response, the tidal swell of crimson light that begins to rise behind my eyes.
The Atlas is all creation, all the purpose in this universe. It calls for progress. It calls for me. Who am I to deny such a force?

Options.Name: Deny the Atlas
Options.Text:
I leave, the Atlas, alone, abandoned.
I feel it begin to scream, a silent shriek that echoes across all of space and time...

IncomingMessages:
Our time here is brief. The galaxy is our burden.

Things fall apart. Entropy holds. We cannot remain.

There is nothing else but the orb. We are alone in the universe.
 
It fills my mind. I am consumed.
